Reviews.Content: Been using it for a few months now. Im just a casual user. Last camera was a Nikon Coolpix 7.1MPThe good: the price for all that you are getting with the camera. You get 18x Zoom that is really quite spectacular. You also get HD video recording. Actual pictures are great once you get the settings down. I fell in love with the Macro and Super Macro. Detail is awesome! Nice vibrant colors as well. Battery life seems pretty good. I use rechargeable batteries and seems to last quite awhile. No complaints here. Size, weight, and overall build quality feels great. Large LCD screen is very nice.The bad: There is lots of noise when recording HD video. You can hear the lens focusing which sounds like a grinding noise. The most annoying thing about the camera is the freeze ups. I have a 4gb Fujifilm SDHC card, and it freezes up on me occasionally when previewing pictures on the card. You have to open up battery compartment to turn it off. It doesnt freeze enough to warrant getting rid of the camera, but it shouldnt happen as frequent as it does. It also froze on me once, just recently, when trying to save an HD video I just recorded to the card. Also, sticking the SD card slot in the battery compartment was a bad design. Camera has to be completely shut down to swap cards.Overall: I got the camera for the 18x Zoom and great picture quality, and thats what it does best. I like having HD video recorder for quick clips. Im happy with the purchase. The negatives of this camera just dont justify spending twice as much on similar cameras by Nikon and Canon if you are a casual user like I am.

Reviews.Title: Not for professionals, but not a "for professionals" price
Reviews.Author: John Shelton
Reviews.Content: This camera is an excellent full feature camera for the "home photographer".  Unlike many fuji cameras that use fuji specific SM or XD cards, this camera uses the more popular SDHC card.  It is easily switchable between electronic viewfinder and 3" LCD viewer screen (I prefer the viewfinder for most of my picture taking).  This camera represents a lot of features for the price and is intuitive and easy to learn and use and comes with a printed basic user manual and has a more detailed user manual available online.  I particularly like the 3" LCD screen because it is big enough to really preview pictures that you have taken, making it easier to determine if you want to try a certain shot over again.The only negative to this camera is that it is a DSLR form factor (yet not a DSLR camera) and is not a camera that you can slip into a shirt pocket.  It is quite lightweight, though, and easy to hold.If this camera lasts as long and performs as reliably as my old camera (Fuji FinePix 1400 ZOOM - more than 10 years old) it will be a very good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great weight and very easy to use!
Reviews.Author: Beth Wilson
Reviews.Content: I am not technical, at all!  My husband is, and he was the one who researched and then recommended this camera.  If you are like me, not technical in the least and like "easy to use" products, I would highly recommend this camera!  The basic features:  Turning it on, zooming in/out, reviewing pictures and deleting, is exceptionally easy to learn.  I am about as dumb as they come!  Trust me!  And it only took me about 5 or 6 times to remember and learn the above basic features!  LOL!  My husband got it the first time!  I LOVE this camera!  I give this camera 5 stars, across the board.HOWEVER, this is one little sticking point that I feel I must address:  The lens cap!!  On MY camera, it will simply NOT stay.  If you move the camera, the cap falls off.  If you put the camera down, the cap falls off.  If you put the camera around your neck, the cap falls off.  I am not exaggerating.  I even pulled up reviews from another site and was actually GLAD to realize that my lens cap is not an isolated incident!  Some folks even said they contacted fujifilm and they said they had never had any complaints, which is bull.  I called fujifilm and like the other folks, was told they have never had a complaint and the lens caps should fit fine.  They, in fact, do not only NOT fit fine.  They just don't fit.  It's so loose that you could blow the lens cap off!  So, like others, I will be getting another lens cap that will actually FIT.  If you do not plan on using the lens cap at all, that's great.  You won't have this problem.  But, if you are like me, and like using it, when the camera is not in use, please be prepared and not surprised, when you get your camera and find the lens cap, for all intents and purposes, is defective.With all that said, I would still highly recommend this camera; especially for the beginner or someone like me, who likes things as easy as possible to use!  Great camera and I LOVE the weight!  I like something I can feel - that isn't so light, the camera moves when you breathe.  This camera fits the bill! Do not let the fact that the lens cap doesn't fit, deter you from buying this camera.  Buy it, and then just go buy another lens cap for it.  It's worth the extra $10.00 to $20.00 for a lens cap.

Reviews.Title: Ok, but doesn't match DSLR.
Reviews.Author: Charles Simmons
Reviews.Content: Though this camera is a major step up from your average point and shoot, it lacks two very important features that would make it the alternative to expensive DSLRs the other reviews led me to believe.Problem one: There is no way to attach a filter without purchasing an adapter, which causes serious vignetting while not zoomed in. If they had simply threaded the lens so it could accept a standard size filter, it would have greatly expanded the functionality of the camera.Problem two: You can't save your images in RAW format. This limits the things you can do with the images in programs like Photoshop and GIMP.Both of these features could have been included, and it wouldn't have affected the average customers point-and-shoot experience with automatic settings.I think if FujiFilm fixed both of those things, this camera would give entry-level DSLR cameras a bit of competition.But it wasn't all bad. The macro and super-macro settings allow for some very close up and highly detailed photos, and the zoom is excellent as well. The ability to manually select ISO (as well as the wide range of ISO settings), f-stop, and shutter speed, make this a really remarkable camera despite my personal complaints with it.So if you're looking for a far better than average point-and-shoot, that can take good photos in a variety of settings, this is the camera to buy.I rated it a 5 across the board, because for what it is, this camera is beyond excellent. If you think you can hold off from spending the money it takes to get even an entry-level DSLR, and pick this camera, you'll be disappointed, as I was. I suggest the serious hobbyist save their money for a while, and buy a better camera when they can afford it.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal!!!
Reviews.Author: Teacher_coach
Reviews.Content: I was a little weary of ordering this camera because of the few bad reviews! I took a chance and it worked out great, I could not be happier with this product. I am very new to photography and wanted a camera that was a little more then point and shoot, but not so sophisticated that I could never figure it out. Great price, great pictures, and great product!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera please read manual before you give negative review.
Reviews.Author: Big Daddy Chapman
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for three days and I love the quality of pictures.  I would tell anyone to read the manual first to get an idea on how to use the camera. I would not call this camera a simple point and shoot camera.  If you are willing to follow the instructions and are willing to play around with camera you will get some great pictures.  I have always had great luck with fuji cameras and this camers just made me love them all the more.  I would not recommend this camera to someone who is not patient enough to learn how to use the camera, but if you do you will be happy with s1800.

Reviews.Title: Fuji Camera
Reviews.Author: Karen Hall
Reviews.Content: This is the first Fuji camera I have used that I am disappointed in.  The picture quality is not what I expected it to be.  The camera is not user friendly.  The flash is really poor.  I had to make a quick decision on which camera to buy and I wish I would have had more time to research other cameras -- Fuji or otherwise.

Reviews.Title: Super camera!
Reviews.Author: Marie
Reviews.Content: I just love this camera!  I took it on some short trips and it captured scenery and distant objects perfectly.  I just love the 18X zoom feature that enables me to get so much closer to my subjects.  I also took it to a concert and the pictures look like I'm sitting in the front row.  The features are also easy to operate and, even though I am technically a beginner in digital photography, after a quick review of the owner's manual, I was able to take great pictures.  I am very satisfied with this product.

Reviews.Title: Nice for the money
Reviews.Author: Allen D. Vestal "Allen"
Reviews.Content: Updated the firmware to 1.4 when I got it. Picture quality is excellent no noise down to ISO 400. If you plan to put it on anything other than automatic be prepared to download the manual from Fuji and read it. Like the viewfinder easy to frame shots in bright light. After owning a more expensive digital SLR I do have a few problems with it. When you pop up the flash the camera does not change to a faster shutter speed.If you normally use the PASM then in P you can not shift the program by shutter speed only by exposure compensation which does not recognize the flash is being used. In Aperture priority mode you only have the choice of minimum or maximum aperture. I leave mine on Shutter priority and set the shutter speed high enough to avoid blur.Zoom is nice took some hand held at maximum zoom that turned out perfect.Software that is supposed to work with Windows 7 crashes on the 64 bit version unless you set comparability to XP.Mini USB plug is so small hard to orient it when plugging it into the camera unless you remember the USB symbol on the plug faces the front of the camera.Video not all that great sound wise.Even after all these gripes I like the camera and it was at a good price. To get anything better would have cost almost 200 dollars more. I have had much more expensive cameras that had noise in shadows even in bright sunlight and I am surprised that a camera that does not have a CMOS sensor can take this kind of quality picture. If this camera is an upgrade from what you have been using you will be very happy. If it is a downgrade from an expensive DSLR you have to live with its quirks.Would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Don't Do It
Reviews.Author: MrsStigg
Reviews.Content: Worst camera I ever owned.My batteries are drained almost as soon as I put them into the camera.The photos are not very good and the settings are always screwed up.

Reviews.Title: Glad I bought mine before it became popular! Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Geeklady "Preacher's Wife"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera November 10, 2010. I paid only $156.16. I'm glad I got mine before this camera became popular! It's a great camera. I have taken photos, videos, etc. and I have not been disappointed. The zoom is great. I needed to videotape programs at my church. I used a 32gb sd card and the movies came out awesome. Love It, Love it, LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: chrisp
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera.  I do a lot of backcountry riding and this camera catches what I am looking at.  For scenery, this camera is amazing.  For wildlife, not so great.  To much of a hesitation before firing.  But for all other uses it is great.  My daughter would like for me to buy a new camera so she can have this one.

Reviews.Title: Great for Beginners
Reviews.Author: scottehthehippo
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the money, I would definitely recommend it over a lot of other starter cameras.The size of this is only a little bigger then a pocket sized camera and it would definitely be worth it to buy this camera over a small personal use camera.Most shots are very clear and the camera has many features that are easy to use. It is almost a perfect cross between professional and personal.Some functions on the camera I don't know anything about as I have never taken classes, but other functions are as easy as going to the menu and selecting what you want for the scene you are taking the photo in. It starts up fast but takes a while to focus witch is something I really dislike as you cannot manually focus. Another thing I don't like about this camera is that it's zoom is digital and the lens can't be removed as far as I know of. Some of you might think there's no problem with having a digital zoom, we'll when your videotaping it makes noise that is captured in the video as the mic is on the side of the camera instead of in the front like it should be. As far as battery consumption goes with this camera, overall I don't really have a problem. I'd say battery life is about up to an hour and this is no problem if you buy a couple sets of rechargeable batteries. The video mode on this isn't as good as I expected it to be; it looks good on the three inch lcd but when its on the computer it is definitely not hd video. I've only gotten it to 480p witch is a major downside. However it's not bad for the price.I really like how this camera can stabilize images when they are moving at a fast pace or in motion. I'd say the ratio to good photos to bad photos of in motion subject is about 60 to 70 if you don't have aperature mode on. Night mode is not very good unless your subject is still and you have it in night(tripod) mode. Regular night mode is ok but its not as good as Night(tripod) mode.If your subject is very still then you will have a great shot it is very clear and I use this mode even when it's not night. auto gives you pretty decent shots and they have an sr auto mode that detects which mode it should be in and switches it automatically, I've gotten some really unique and great shots from this mode that I like a lot.Overall if your looking for a great mid personal to professional dslr camera that's affordable than this is just for you, but if your looking for a more professional camera I would recommend saving more for a better dslr.

Reviews.Title: blurry photos
Reviews.Author: wendy
Reviews.Content: I admit I am not the most tech savvy person but this camera is very hard to use and does not get quality clear photos on a consistent basis. I would not recommend =(

Reviews.Title: Not good at all
Reviews.Author: Maine
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this camera but it fell very short. Pictures are grainy and blurry and video is just ok there are 2 strange noises you hear durring video playback, If you use zoom while shooting a video you'll hear the loud motors in the camera on your video durring playback, this dosent happen when using digital zoon though. 2 durring normal video play you'll here a noise that i can only describe as someone running their hands over a balloon the noise that makes. all in all very poor cameraPro:Looks and Styleok video qualityCons:Grainy blurry picturesNoise durring recorded video playback

Reviews.Title: Excelent Product
Reviews.Author: David E. Castillo A.
Reviews.Content: Excellent balance between features and price. It is the perfect camera for those looking for something more than a point and shoot but are still not ready for an expensive SLR camera. I love that it is not bulky. It is very comfortable to carry around in a case. Pictures are of great quality. Much better than your regular point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Wow
Reviews.Author: Skipper W
Reviews.Content: Bought one as gift for a friend.  I saw that he had done with the Video and special effects.  So....the price was virtually free considering other options (and I am sure better products available). But I use mine just for "snaps" and "vids" rather than graphic arts ie:"photography" and "cinemetography". I love it....and the support from Fuji. Mine had a hum in the audio on video playback. I contacted Fuji's service people. No problems, sent it in and 2 weeks later I got it back and it works perfectly. Great pics, effects and Fuji quality. If you just want a camera to have fun with and casual use, this is it. Batteries suck down pretty quick with videos though. Got about 20 mins on alkalines. My giftee uses Lithium rechargeables and gets about 30 to 40....depending on ???.

Reviews.Title: Worthless Piece of Junk
Reviews.Author: SMH
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera based on the zoom capability and number of megapixels.  After taking less than one hundred pictures, the camera began to display intermittent error messages.  Eventually (less than 200 pictures), the board failed and the cost to repair it exceeded the cost of the camera.  The picture quality and creative control are just average.  My wife has a Nikon that cost 30% less and produces pictures of a quality far superior to this one.  Fuji should have stayed with making fairly good film and passed on selling cameras that are a worthless piece of junk.  I would recommend purchasing from any of the major-name companies that make cameras (Canon, Nikon, Pentax, Kodak, etc.) rather than Fujifilm.  You'll save money and a lot of frustration in the long run.

Reviews.Title: Love this Camera
Reviews.Author: Mark Twain "nursey"
Reviews.Content: Have had this Camera since Dec. 2010 and still using same batteries.  I have had cameras suck up batteries like there is no tomorrow.  This one doesn't do that.The only problem I had was it was very picky about the memory card.  The odd part is I have a micro card with an adapter that it chose to recognize instead of the standard media card.  Well this is actually better for me since I can now easily load images on my android tablet and my mac.Picture quality is excellent.  I am not a pro with camera's but I can tell the difference of blurry and crystal clear.You get crystal clear with this camera.The price is so crazy low for everything you get.I would say this would be for a mid level person.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: M. Peery
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera for a couple of months now.  I really like using it.  It is of course more bulky than your miniture point and shoot cameras, but the quality is great and the 18X optical zoom is great.  At times there can be a blurry picture in low light if you don't keep the camera steady.  The lens cap falls off very easily so we had to buy a case to carry it in.  I love the camera, but I can't carry it with me very easily.  over all.  A GREAT CAMERA.

Reviews.Title: S1800
Reviews.Author: Art
Reviews.Content: This camera is an excellent value.  It provides high resolution and all of the features in a lightweight package. Great for travel.Limitations are in the lens. f3.1/5.6 are not as fast as my previous camera. Aperture control is limited.

Reviews.Title: My Fuji S1800
Reviews.Author: Sandy-kun
Reviews.Content: +ves. Nice camera. Good value for money. Well number of built in modes and options. Excellent stabilized zoom of 18x-ves. Poor image quality in low light. No built in battery. Instead uses 4 AA size batteries (which generally lasts for less time when using flash).. No rechargeable batteries, No carry case, No memory card along with the camera. (You have to order them separately)Summery:For any one who is thinking to go for a Semi-SLR, Fuji s18000 is a good choice.I recommend this for who is getting started to learn photography and not willing put more bucks in the early stage of learning.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: tc
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my daughter for Christmas.  She has been bugging us for a good camera for two years, but I wasn't going to pay $350-$400 for a camera for a 15 year old.  After reading reviews by professional photographers on this camera I decided to purchase it.  The camera is everything they said and my daughter is thrilled with it.  Great quality pix and nice camera features.  There is no sense in paying more for a mid-level camera.  If you are going to spend $400, go a bit more and get a digital SLR.  If not, this is a great camera that is better than the $150-$200 simple point and shoots.

Reviews.Title: Highly Recommended!  Love it!
Reviews.Author: Hfranks
Reviews.Content: I just recd the camera for Christmas and so far I love it.  The quality of the pictures are amazing...crystal clear!!!! I have not been thru all of the features but what I have been thru, it is easy to understand and the manual is also helpful.  The blink detection is wonderful and it even deletes the photo if a blink is detected. I did my research before deciding on a camera and I definitely made the right choice.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Quality
Reviews.Author: Kenny L
Reviews.Content: After hours of online comparison between the Nikon L110, the Fuji S2550 and this S1800 camera, I finally made the choice to purchase this camera instead. And I wasn't dissappointed.I purchased the S1800 because of the quality of the zoom, and speed of the camera compared to the Nikon.I also purchased the S1800 because of the ease of menu navigation I was used to with a previous Fujifilm F50fd.The shots compared with the S1800 and the F50fd were amazing, even though both cameras are at 12mp.The S1800 outshines in clarity, less noise and overall better picture, especially in low light photos.The body is small, but very lightweight, very easy to carry around.The only downside I have with this camera is that it takes 4 AA batteries, and is a bottom loading SD card. (Means I have to take off the tripod every time to get the SD card out)And that the battery cover seems cheap and flimsy.The camera also makes a low whining noise in quiet situations when the lens is turned on, but it shouldn't bother most people.The main problem that people have against this camera is the SD card not being compatible, but I have not have that issue, my 16gb Kingston SDHC card has no issues at all. Even my other generic brand SD cards have no problem being read, including Kodak 4gb SD, Panasonic 2gb SD, and an imitation chinese brand SD cards has no problems at all. If you have problems with your SD card, you can format them from your camera.Another problem that people have with this Camera from previous reviews I've read is the blurriness.With a ultra zoom camera, you're GOING to have blur if you're not using a tripod to steady the camera, This isn't exactly a point and shoot camera. And for those who are unfamiliar with photography, do not know how to use manual mode, and only use automatic mode will lower the quality of all photos.Overall, I can say that this is one of the best product I've bought in 2010.Not exactly a Point and Shoot camera, and not exactly a DSLRFor $150, you definitely cannot go wrong with this purchase.$150 is a good investment to practice photography and learning how to use a camera and how they function before actually purchasing a DSLR

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Jason Lawrence
Reviews.Content: love the camera. Excellent features for price.  Optical zoom good, photo quality good. only downside is delay before taking photo.

Reviews.Title: Best value I ever got on a point and shoot digital camera
Reviews.Author: L. Leabres
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1. Price, very competitive for all the features, extreme digital zoom, full manual control, burst modes2. Pretty much satisfies as a "bridge" camera between point/shoot and DSLR for a nice price3. Got a FUJI free case (you'll want one unless it you want it scratched up in your backpackCons: 1. Not for the the beginner or inexperienced digital photographer - you have to know your ideal shooting settings and lighting conditions to get all what this camera offers2. For those being awed by the specs, ie very long digital zoom, you'll need a tripod for each shot but the wide angle is awesome3. Not the best in low light if yo don't want flash so you'll have to go ISO 400 or higher and hopefully your photo editing software can erase the noise and bring in the dynamic range.4. The HD video is excellent on optical setting but average with the super long digital setting so don't think you're getting both a great camera for photos and super HD video because the video even at 720p with all the zoom and wide angles is not as nice as the Flip but better than Creativer Vado 2nd Gen.here's my video review of this camera:[...]

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: H. Masengale
Reviews.Content: I am not a professional photographer by any means but I am a photograhic hobbiest. After reading countless reviews on several cameras I decided that since the price and reviews were good on this camera I wanted to give it a try. I was leary because I thought that no camera this cheap could be good for anything except snap shots (basically I thought it was a hopped up point and shoot). BOY WAS I WRONG!! I have used the camera about a dozen times in the last few days and it is fantastic! The images are crystal clear and sharp. I was able to take a phenominal photo of the moon tonight that showed the craters and everything (much like the one in the image gallery). My portrait photos have so far been beautiful. I've used it in low light indoors, night time with no light outside, and in natural light outdoors and have yet to be disappointed. If you are looking for something more than a point and shoot that doesn't break the bank I highly recommend this camera! One word of advice tho...read the manual and learn the camera. If you don't know how to properly use a piece of equipment you aren't going to get the best results.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: Eddie H. Johnson "Ehj"
Reviews.Content: I usualy pick up this camera over my SLR camera because I have my zoom lens included. I dont have to carrie the extra lens in a bag.This camera does every thing  the instructions say it will do.I love my point and shoot camera for being able to place in my pocket. But this camera is way ahead of it. it is the best camera for the price i have ever purchased

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: J.C.
Reviews.Content: I am a photographer who takes pictures of female models. For years I have been using point and shoot cameras and have gotten great results. I expanded to family portraits and children and needed a camera immediately to help me with my new subjects. Since kids can be impatient and move around alot or lose interest in the middle of a shoot I needed to be able to capture them at the right moment. This great camera has blink detection and multi shooting, it's amazing, the quality is great, the zoom is terrific and all in all it is one of the best cameras I have ever used. To see some of the work produced with this awesome camera visit [...] / [...]. This ia a great camera and i would recommend it to any amateur or professional for personal or business use. You cant beat the price for what you get with this.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Walter E. Fitzpatrick
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my father. He needed a replacement for his broken camera, but needed a better one than the pocket Samsung he previously had.This camera fit the need and then some. Yet was still easy enough for a 70 year old man to figure out and become a master with it.The gear, options, for the price, made this an awesome buy.

Reviews.Title: Review of New Camera
Reviews.Author: Lawrence E. Dixon "Ledwy"
Reviews.Content: Ordered Fujifilm FinePix S1800 Digital Camera online from Amazon because (1) I trust Amazon (2) best price available (3) all local prices much more than through Amazon...arrived in a timely manner in perfect and excellent condition.  Have used and found to be "THE" product for me after "much" research as to what would meet my minds.  Thanks to Amazon, my needs are once again met!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great lens
Reviews.Author: David Godfrey
Reviews.Content: The attraction for me was the lens, it is a moderate wide angle to good telephoto. It is a little bulky, but for the lens and the price is a great value.

Reviews.Title: BANG FOR THE BUCK
Reviews.Author: cwheel001
Reviews.Content: THIS FUJIFILM S 1800 FINEPIX IS A REALLY NICE CAMERA.IT TOOK ME A LITLE WHILE TO FIGURE IT OUT BUT ONCE I DID IT TAKES GREAT PICTURES.I BOUGHT IT FOR MY WIFE FOR CHRISTMAS, SHE SAYS IT TAKE WONDERFUL PICTURES.SO FOR THE PRICE AND THE QUALITY OF PICTURE  ITS A DEAL..... ENJOY THE FUJIFILM FINEPIX S1880/S1880........

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Money
Reviews.Author: J. Kintz
Reviews.Content: Sure, you are not going to get the same images with this camera that you would with a $900 Digital SLR but this is a great little camera for the money.  I purchased this camera to take on a cruise vacation where there would be times on and off the ship, outside tours and I wanted a reliable camera but not an expensive one in case something should happen to it.  This camera far outperformed my expectations and I saved some great images from my vacation.  I really like the fact that this camera uses AA batteries that you can find cheap anywhere and not some $60 proprietary battery that becomes harder to find with age.  I carry this camera in my car wherever I go and give it a solid 2 thumbs up for the price of this camera.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT BUY
Reviews.Author: RGA
Reviews.Content: I HAD A KODAK BEFORE, NO COMPARISON TO THE FUJI. THE CLOSE UP SHOTS ARE GREAT. TIME WILL TELL, SO FAR SO GOOD,

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: AJL
Reviews.Content: I am in no way a pro at taking photos but I wanted to take the next step and go for a camera that was better then my smaller point and shoot. I have taken a few shots with it and I have to say I really enjoy this camera.  The pictures are clear, and the the features and zoom are great. The camera has a good feel in the hand plus all of the buttons are easy to reach.In all it is just a great camera. My only real problem is with the software that comes with it. It is not as user friendly as I am used to but it is nothing to stress over. Also it runs on AA batteries so be sure to always have them on hand or buy some rechargeable AA batteries. I would recommended this camera (and the accessory package that is recommended for it) to anyone looking to take the next step into the world of photography.

Reviews.Title: Good value for the price!
Reviews.Author: Amandatrtl
Reviews.Content: I got my camera yesterday finally. I took it out of the box and pretty much used point-and-shoot to snap a number of pictures. I have to say I'm pretty happy with the result! There were a number of pictures that turned out blurry, but I was taking pictures of my 19 month old, so I pretty much expected that. The screen is very grainy when it's being used to shoot pictures, but the graininess clears when you're reviewing the pictures for some reason (doesn't make much sense to me). For a person going from a regular point-and-shoot digital camera, this is an excellent (inexpensive) step up! I've been very pleasantly surprised with the quality of this camera so far. I looked at a number of other types of cameras before I settled on this one and am glad that I did so far.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm FinePix S1800 12.2 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Shez
Reviews.Content: I love it! I take pictures of birds, flowers, knitting, dogs and this camera is perfect. I haven't figured it all out yet, there's lots of settings, but I've taken some great pictures. If you're looking for a camera that is light weight, takes super indoor and outdoor pictures, easy to use but also lots of fancy settings for when you get better at it, then this is it. My daughter was so thrilled with it she ordered herself one a few days after I got mine, and she takes amazing pictures. I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Really good for the price
Reviews.Author: gé gaspé
Reviews.Content: This camera is good in exterior shot on bright sunshine.In inside, it is better to use the flash than the stabilizer.I will recommended as a first camera to travel with.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera for its price
Reviews.Author: Georgios Andrikopoulos
Reviews.Content: I am an average user of photo cameras. I think that the S1800 includes all those characteristics that an average user would like his/her photo camera to include. 12MP, zoom 18x wide, easy of use camera, etc. When I opened the box, I felt very familiar with the camera and that feeling continued when I turned on and took the first photos. At the end, it is just 150$ camera and it is worth every penny of it. The lid of the batteries closes and opens relatively easy. Probably the people who rated with a low star this camera had some extreme expectations from this (150$) camera. My overall impression is totally positive.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Brit
Reviews.Content: I purchase this camera for my girlfriend for x-mas, in hopes it would be exactly the camera she wanted. I received the camera in 2 days! I hate ordering things on the computer b/c you really never know what your gonna get well....this was awesome I love it, I took a snap shot w/it just to test it out and the picture is crystal clear. Wonderful product and great purchasing experience, I will most deff order from amazon again. If your looking for a amazing camera for a great price this is the one for you!

Reviews.Title: Excellent value!!
Reviews.Author: SoundGeek
Reviews.Content: I'm a novice photographer who was looking for a camera for typical uses such as social events etc.The quality and feel are above what I expected for the price I paid.The camera also takes great close up pictures ( using super macro feature ). Auto mode is good, but not great, especially in certain shaded lighting conditions.The 18x zoom feature is really amazing for a camera of this type and price. The image stabilization is also decent.I also chose this camera because of the EVF, which is very handy when taking photos in bright sunlight where even the best LCD becomes hard to see. Again for a camera in this price range, a great feature.The weight is nice and light for a "megazoom" Point and shoot.Battery life is not very long, as this camera uses a lot of power, so extra batteries on trips is recommended.Build quality is excellent, doesn't feel flimsy to me at all, based on some reviews I read stating a cheap feel. I am an engineer, so I know what junk is, and this camera is very nicely put together.The LCD is very good, not top notch, but very useable.The free PC software that is available for the camera is pretty minimal, but has some decent auto-correction features for lightening up underexposed photos.Night low light photos are OK, but I am not an expert at how to get really great low light photos, for what its worth.I would highly recommend this camera for the casual user who wants something with a little more flexibility than the pocket point and shoots for around the same price. Note: This camera is not a pocket size camera. I highly recommend getting a camera case for it.

Reviews.Title: I absolutely love this camera
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: For the price that this is sold at the different retailers, this is a an amazing value.  One thing that called my attention about this camera was the panoramic feature.  It allows you to take three pictures for this.  The first picture you take normal the second picture has a thin piece of the first picture so that you can pair it as much as posible and the third picture has a piece of the 2nd picture for the same reason.  Once you click the third time it automatically creates the panoramic picture in a matter of seconds.The other feature that I tried was taking picture on a moving object... like my ceiling fan while it was in medium speed.  When I zoomed in and took the pic, the fan blades appeared to be suspended in mid air with no bluriness.  I was impressed.  I bought it for our trip to Disney... once we return, I will post a more detailed review.  and maybe some pictures... we'll see...

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value Camera...
Reviews.Author: Darlene Alseth
Reviews.Content: This camera has a lot of positives for the price and does a lot of things fairly well: fast power up time, shot to shot time, zoom time. Excellent zoom/quick-zoom features and multi-frame shooting. The negatives are slow click to capture time and it has trouble reproducing some colors accurately.I would rate overall image quality as average at best (but again you can't expect SLR quality at this price). View sample photos taken with the S1800 at [...]

Reviews.Title: Best picture quality for the money
Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: Before buying the s1800, I did the "would you hang this photo on your wall?" test for each photo uploaded by users on the amazon site for the s1800, the kodak, the olympus, and the panasonic  (the four cameras with telephoto of 18x optical or higher in this price range).  There is no comparison.  The s1800 photos as a whole look far more professional.  The s1800 seems to have a black element added to the photo processing so blacks are really black and not a blend of primary colors.  This camera loves black and white and shadows. The colors are vivid and sharp, especially against a dark background or subjects that have flecks fof black.  I have already taken several photos I am proud to hang on my wall.  It is the perfect camera to make you look like a pro on an amateur budget.  By the way, the s1800 is $50-$150 less than the others in the comparison.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Hans
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my wife as she was getting annoyed with her old Canon camera. She's still very much an amatuer with digital photography, but she's getting more interested in photography and wanted a better camera. She is EXTREMELY happy with this camera - takes great pictures, it's easy to use. No complaints whatsoever. This camera is a great buy.

Reviews.Title: fuji camera
Reviews.Author: GIN@
Reviews.Content: the camera is very easy to use and i was looking for a camera that would give me the professional look with out the professional price. i definitely got it in this camera! it is very easy to take along as well as most girls don't want a huge camera in there purse this little camera definitely has the compact look with the professional pictures! very happy with my choice.

Reviews.Title: what i think of the finepix s1800
Reviews.Author: J
Reviews.Content: i've had this camera for more than a month now. at first my main gripes about it were the incidence of blurry pictures and the battery life. since then i've found that if i megazoomed out to something thats too close (for instance <15 feet), it will be blurry. lighting conditions should be good. if not use a tripod or flash - i've gotten great results. i was disappointed with the rechargeable battery life at first but since i've gotten some newer batteries (rayovac precharged), charged and fully discharge them once they've been long lasting. i would have liked a battery gauge that is on all the time.the good: great size, easy to handle, evf is a big plus, aa battery, my lens cap does not fall off, zoom is great for animal pictures.in short the value for money for the features is unsurpassed. is the quality going to be as good as more expensive cameras? yes - if you learn how the camera and photographic conditions would work together. to me it is more of an slr than p&s.;

Reviews.Title: good for the price
Reviews.Author: cendy_d
Reviews.Content: great price...picture quality is good cant complain but then again im not no pro photographer..just like taking pics of the fam..so for me was great..it is battery charged which is ok for me sense i dont use it constantly

Reviews.Title: FujifinePix 1800S continues to impress
Reviews.Author: jsus
Reviews.Content: HiBased on the reviews i bought this camera and i am getting to like it really!The SP mode is pretty cool and lets you choose different shooting modes and i really love the PANAROMA mode. Took some neat pictures in that mode.The optical zoom is excellent (18X)The image clarity is good you can't go wrong when you a depth of 12million pixels.The zoom option while video recording is awesomeI am amazed that you can get a very good camera for $150. Back in the day i spent close to $500 for a Minolta Analog SLR camera that provided half of the features. Fuji has come a long way and i definitely recommend the FujifinePIX1800S to folks who are on a tight budget but want a nice camera that is capable of taking quality photos and recording nice videos.TWO THUMBS UP!

Reviews.Title: Overall good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: B-Money
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera just before I went on a tour of some cities in Europe. I am impressed with the quality of the photos, both day and night. Only a couple of things bothered me somewhat:When shooting night photos, the LCD is very grainy so you have to take it on faith that your positioning is correct. Once you snap the photo and review, 9 times out of 10, the picture is good.On a quiet day or in a quiet room, you can hear the zoom sound of the lens if you are in video mode. Usually when I'm recording though, there's background noise that drowns that zoom noise out.Other than those things pointed out, no other real issues.

Reviews.Title: What a Fantastic Camera .
Reviews.Author: Amr Ashraf "Amro Ashraf Mostafa"
Reviews.Content: I'm really amazed with This Camera FinPix S1800 , it's my first time to deal with digital cameras and here I'm taking shots like professionals , just set it to Auto mode if you are beginner like me and see the results .The Flash is really great , the zoom is unbelievable , I can take shots from about 100 meter , no one notice me so that I can take shots in the forbidden areas :D .The Panasonic battery that comes with  the Cam last with me for about 500 shot , 100 of them using the flash mode , Also the LCD is very clear , not bad as I've read in some reviews here .If you an amateur like me , I recommend you to use this Cam , it's value is really very very great to it's features besides it is very easy to use .I recommend to buy this bag if you don't have one : [...]It have enough rooms for the cam , batteries and more .I recommend also to buy this battery charger including 4 rechargeable batteries : [...]you must have it as it will save a lot of money .And also this memory card : [...]working perfectly with the cam .This is the package that I've purchased and receive and everything is working perfectly .

Reviews.Title: Value for money
Reviews.Author: Ronald
Reviews.Content: I saw the video of how the camera works and ordered 1 and so far I'm not disappointed at all.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera--but video zoom noise no fun
Reviews.Author: M. Molinaro
Reviews.Content: UPDATE: 10-17-10The zoom broke after less than two months--it will no longer extend fully and sounds like the gears that extend the lens are slipping.  I did a quick search on the internet and didn't find other reports of the zoom breaking quickly, so I'm assuming this is unusual.  Amazon was helpful in explaining how to return the camera for a refund--they can't replace it for some reason to do with the supplier.I won't change my review rating, since random units of anything break and this doesn't appear to have been a problem for others.Have had this camera for over a month now.  I agree with all the positives--super macro is outstanding and the stabilization is pretty good--and a couple of negatives:1. The noise the zoom makes when shooting video is very loud--it's great to be able to zoom while shooting, but the noise level is bad;2. The lens cap doesn't stay on in a backpack and is otherwise easy to knock off.If you haven't had a good macro or a super zoom ratio, this can change the kinds of photos you take.  And I haven't even mastered the various exposure modes yet.

Reviews.Title: A point and shoot camera capable of SLR quality photos
Reviews.Author: Alan C. Simkin
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera through Amazon about two weeks ago, and I have been very happy with my purchase.  When you consider this camera's sub-$200 dollar price in light of what it is able to do, there's no way to give it fewer than five stars.  Unless you plan on becoming a professional photographer, this is the last camera you'll ever need.  I have already taken sports page quality telephoto pictures of my daughter's soccer games, and HD quality video of school events.  This camera is amazing!  The image stability works as advertised, as does the blink detection.  The 18x zoom is just unbelievable, you can get on-the-field type pictures at events.  You are getting so much camera per dollar spent that you literally can't go wrong with a Fuji.To be objective, let me mention a few of the camera's weak points.  I mention these with the understanding that none of these detract from the five-star rating when considered in terms of the its price. First, the auto focus system is not quite the equal of the high powered zoom the camera has.  What happens is, if you're trying to take an action shot at extreme range, the camera will not focus quickly enough to get the shot you want.  To overcome this you have to anticipate the shot you want.  You partly depress the shutter button which activates the autofocus.  When it's "on" it will give you a yellow crosshair type reticle.  Keep it depressed as you track your subject, then snap the picture slightly ahead (before, prior to) of the scene you want.  It takes some practice, but you can get excellent shots doing this.  You face a similar challenge when using the motor drive feature.  You just have to make sure that you are "pre-focused" on your subject before you start shooting.Second, the camera's microphone is located near the lens.  When you are video taping and you use the zoom feature, it ends up being pretty lound on the soundtrack.  I would point out, however, that you only notice this when taking quiet videos, like nature or something like that.  At a sports event, you'll never hear it because the ambient crowd noise more than drowns it out.  It doesn't really bother me, but it is noticable.Despite these weaknesses, my five star vote stands intact and unblemished.  For under two hundred dollars, you're gonna love this camera!  It is probably one of the most versatile and capable non-SLR digitals that has ever been marketed.  Fuji deserves a lot of kudos for creating such a fantastic camera, and bringing it in at such an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: Gutta have one!!! LOVE IT!!!!
Reviews.Author: DACADA
Reviews.Content: I love it. Sooo easy to use..Picture are awesome. Awesome zoom thing look like there are inches away. I think everyone should have this camera. It takes AA batteries that make's it easy. It uses a disk that u can find anywhere. I can't think of a bad thing to say. For the price and quality of pictures you can't go wrong with this buy.

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. Wanted to get an SLR with changeable lenses, but wasn't willing to pay the money for one. This camera is awesome, it has a fantastic zoom, you can choose what you want the focus to be on by holding down the shutter button halfway and ten oushing it the rest of the way to take the picture. Macro option works awesome for close-ups, and the panoramic feature is so cool! You can connect three frames into one. Main drawback is while doing video if you zoom and out you can hear the motor grinding. Also a lot of lag time after pushing the button and taking the picture, so you have to anticipate the timing if photographing moving objects or expressions on peoples faces, kind of frustrating especially for faces, but awesome for landscapes and other still photography.

Reviews.Title: S1800
Reviews.Author: Elmer Feldotto
Reviews.Content: It has a whole bunch of upgrades over my Fuji 5000 that I've had and liked for several years. Nice addition to my Pentax K10 with a Tamron 18-250 lens.

Reviews.Title: Was jsut what we needed
Reviews.Author: Odney
Reviews.Content: Just needed a camera for some demo shots. This works just fine for that. It was shipped promptly and arrived with everything.

Reviews.Title: fuji S1800 ideal for a starter amateur photographer
Reviews.Author: laseca
Reviews.Content: The camera is of friendly use,  love the quality of the pictures and I am still learning all the features,  but it has given me good pictures... I am happy with it...

Reviews.Title: Love camera
Reviews.Author: cinda
Reviews.Content: I am very happy I choose this camera. It is rather small and light weight. It is like having a point and shoot and CLR with out dealing with the lenses. Great for a beginner and advanced photographer.It comes with a lot and easy to use whistles and bells. One feature I thought was funny that it has and would come in handing for those who like to take a lot picture of people is blink detection.

Reviews.Title: Used It At E3 And Loved It!
Reviews.Author: Zach D. Reese
Reviews.Content: I had a chance to use this particular camera, receiving it right before I was to leave on a plane to Los Angeles to attend E3, a video game expo for media and other players in the industry. I attended the Activision concert and was able to take these really amazing photos even from far back. I was amazed at how far I could zoom in to snap some ace photos of Usher, Eminem, and Chris Cornell of Soundgarden.The only downsides? I had grabbed a random SD card my family owned to use for my photos, and found out too late that the camera only takes Class 4 SD cards. This means that I was only able to take a max of around 8 photos my entire trip at E3. Not only that, but I lost the box that the camera came in on the flight to LA (I was all caught up trying to help this man with his luggage that I left the box under the seat after I had grabbed my carryon). So, I wasn't able to take the current photos off my camera, and had to rely on these two eyes of mine for the rest of the trip. You can't use a typical mini-USB plug on this camera since the plug is more square than rectangle, so I have yet to find a cable that is compatible with this one. But really, I was really, really upset that the camera doesn't recognize anything other than Class 4 cards. I certainly do not like having to go out of my way to find compatible products. This is why I gave it 4 stars. I may amend this review after I order a new card, but what a hassle! If it only accepted every class of SD cards like most Canon cameras do, and accept universal mini-USB cables, this would have almost unanimous 5 star reviews on Amazon and be a constant best seller in my opinion!Other than the experience above and the sad loss of the box, this camera was a real treat and I had some amazing photos. Even those in my family who owned digital cameras were really envious of the shots I was able to take even with all of the movement and intense sensory overload that E3 provided me!

Reviews.Title: A picture is worth a thousand words!
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: I'm just an amateur photographer, but I've been thrilled with the photos I've been able to take with this camera.  It does have a few drawbacks, like the lens cap popping off whenever you turn it on, even just to look at the pictures you've stored on the memory card, and a slightly grainy LCD display especially in low light settings, but the end results are well worth those minor annoyances to me.  I've posted some of the best pictures I've taken with it, and like they say, a picture is worth a thousand words!

Reviews.Title: Great for the $$
Reviews.Author: S. Paczosa
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this camera to replace my sony cybershot. I was looking for a middle ground between my Cannon Rebel XT Digital SLR and a basic point n shoot .... THIS CAMERA IS IT ! ! ! I LOVE LOVE LOVE this camera ! It is light weight, very simple to operate, great photos, decent video, and the zoom is great !

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Doris M. Brown "Doris M. Brown"
Reviews.Content: I just purchased this camera a couple months ago and so far I have no complaints.  It does just about what I expected.  The zoom lens works great.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Camera for the Growing Photographer
Reviews.Author: Kyle "Knox"
Reviews.Content: I've had the S1800 for about a month now, I bought it after much reading and researching of comparative cameras, going through mayne reviews and sites... i had my eyes on the DSLR, Olympus E-520, but thought that I should start with a point and shoot with advanced full manual control. And the S1800 is just this. Take amazing pictures after Learning about Aperture, ISO, and Shutter Speed; would be great if there was manual focus as well, but auto-focus does a very nice job most of the time.Camera feels of high quality, except the lever for zooming at times gets stuck and feels a little cheap. The screen is a little fuzzy when taking pics but is brilliant when playing back pictures \ video.These are the only minor cons that i have with this camera and the pro's massively exceed these problems... due to the fact that the camera takes magnificent pics... that can compare to a DSLR (if you familiarize urself with the advanced settings)

Reviews.Title: Low Quality Pictures
Reviews.Author: Satisfied Customer "Tiffany"
Reviews.Content: I am so disappointed by this camera.  It is hit or miss and while SOMETIMES I get fantastic pictures, other times they turn out grainy and fuzzy.  My old 7 Megapixel Canon Powershot took better pictures! By that I mean they turned out softer looking, with better lighting.  I have read the entire manual and tried everything but still, I can't seem to get clear pictures. Grainy is the best way to describe them. I am so very disappointed by this camera after reading all the great reviews.

Reviews.Title: Simple Camera, Great Pictures
Reviews.Author: Windsor
Reviews.Content: I've always owned a small point and shoot camera, but decided it was time to move up in a camera. My only criteria was to have a reasonable zoom, easy to use, and take somewhat decent pictures most of the time. The Fuji S1800 as surpassed these expectations at a great price. Yes, there are other models out there for not much more with some extra features but I just wanted a simple camera. The quality of pictures are some of the best I have taken with a digital camera. For those reviews stating the camera was difficult to use or performed poorly try to read the manual. I'm not a heavy manual reader, but have found reading them for digital camera's can go a long way.

Reviews.Title: Still Five Stars Even Though I Own A DSLR
Reviews.Author: Ms_Ladi "...just wandering the world."
Reviews.Content: First thing I thought as soon as I cracked open the box was, "Ugh, AA-batteries".  Second thing was "Whoah, this baby is TINY".  Okay, as someone who normally shoots with a 7D, Leica M8, and various other higher end point and shoots, I thought I would be the wrong person to really review this, so I gave it to my niece to shoot with--the budding photographer.  Outcome:  excellent camera.  In capable hands, one is extremely thankful for in-camera zoom (first and foremost, that is hands down the best thing about this camera).  It's not great at all in low light, but I found that compared to run-of-the-mill point and shoots, it was about average.  Also, my niece used the flash a lot and it was just fine.  She came out with a couple of winners, which goes to show it's not always about the camera, but the photographer behind it.Photogs on a budget:  Get this.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed
Reviews.Author: AKR "AKR"
Reviews.Content: I have been an amature photographer for about 12 years now and this is actually my girlfriends camera. I haven't used this camera a ton yet, but so far, I really don't like this camera. It's pretty bad in even slightly low light. A lot of pictures end up blurry. It is horrible at preserving the real colors. When you shoot in manual mode, there is no preview mode, so you get to guess and shoot it over and over until it looks right. The software is virtually impossible to use. Some cameras will allow you to bypass the software and simple click on the memory card under "my computer" and just manually transfer things over. Not this camera. You have to use it's horrible software which I cannot for the life of me get to work. I grew up with computers and am fairly tech savy, but this has me banging my head into the wall. I read the instructions and that didn't help. Ended up just getting a memory card reader and saying to heck with the camera/software method. Honestly, the Canon Powershot with 6 mp was 5x as good as this camera and I was used to point and shoots being poor cameras. I find myself not really even wanting to take many pictures with this thing anymore because most of them are disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Difficulties with Windows 7
Reviews.Author: Doc Goodbyte "Doc"
Reviews.Content: The sofware supplied with this camera is not compatible with Windows 7 and you must download an update. I was surprised that the camera was not natively compatible with (my) Windows 7 or Picassa when I plugged the USB connection. This was bizarre and may have been a unique situation with my computer. I also had difficulty getting the downloaded update to perform properly. Looks like they still have some bugs to work out with Windows 7. This was a deal breaker for me and I returned the camera. Worked very well with Fuji Windows Vista Software and was also natively recognized by Windows Vista. Otherwise the camera worked well and has amazing capabilities.

Reviews.Title: Slightly dissapointed
Reviews.Author: P. Ma
Reviews.Content: I patiently researched and waited 2 months before buying this camera, and was slightly disappointed with blue specks showing up on the LCD screen when pointing the camera into darkness/black objects.I only saw one other reviewer comment on this issue and I'm surprised this wasn't commented more often in other reviews, because this is a very big negative.

Reviews.Title: Great Bang For The Buck
Reviews.Author: Leo Schneggenburger
Reviews.Content: Update:I have had my S1800 for over 6 months now. I was very impressed with my initial pictures taken at Letchworth State Park last Autumn and I wanted to update the review after some real experience with it. I am not a pro but I do use this professionally (I am a Realtor). I had several years experience with a 6MP Fuji P&S; and that was not an easy decision since I am from the home of Kodak. I needed a couple of features which that did not have, namely a through the lens viewer and a wider angle lens capability. Both features work great. The wide view is not so wide as to cause distortion and the lens capability allows me to take better shots without dealing with glare on the ample back screen.As I learn more about photograghy I realize that there are other features I would like to explore but the bottom line is those require a full on DSLR camera. This has more to do with special flash functions than higher quality pictures. If you are looking for a P&S; camera that has high quality picture quality as well as a whole host of special features, this is it at a modest price.  I am learning about bracketing and HDR- if you have no idea what I am talking about then you probably don't need to spend one penny more for another camera.I had a few issues which were from unfamiliarity. I am not impressed with the manual (online), however my latest issue (it stopped taking pictures which is unconvenient at least) was resolved very quickly by Fuji. (Tip: 1-800-800-3854) If something odd like that happens, try this: Menu; Setup; Reset; OK.If need be I may update this again.Original:I just received this a few days ago. I went to Letchworth State Park in NY to take advantage of the fall colors and try out the camera. For some reason the Chrome selection does not work. It just toggles past it. What disturbs me is that nothing in the manual talks about warranty. After chasing my tail with Amazon (seems the best option is probably going to be to return it), I got a link to Fuji and am waiting to hear back to see if there is some software update to correct this. Anyway, in the warranty verbiage they talk about refurbished parts or camera to solve the issue. Whoa there! If I wanted refurbished I would have bought one for less money!Hopefully there will be a software fix for this problem. I have had a simpler Fuji camera for a number of years and it has worked flawlessly giving great pictures. That was one of the primary reasons I chose to go with this one. BTW, I took a look at the pictures I took at the park (149 to be exact due to battery life) and I expected to have a lot of throw away shots (I am no pro). I was extremely impressed with how they came out. It seems the Fuji quality pictures are still available with this camera. In fact the chrome function is available on my older Fuji. Anyway I will follow up once this is resolved so as to give proper feedback (I haven't thrown in the towel on this, I just want it fixed). BTW, I bought a Durecell charger and spare batteries. I think they are a must with digital. I used the Discharge function to finish them off as out of the box they were not near full charge. This is all to be expected. If you order this or another that takes AA's just go ahead and get one at the same time. You will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing as a successor to the S5200
Reviews.Author: RAC
Reviews.Content: Fujifilm FinePix S1800 12.2 MP Digital Camera with 18x Wide Angle Optical Dual Image Stabilized Zoom and 3-Inch LCDI purchased the S1800 to be an upgrade from my S5200 with which I was very pleased.  I wanted to obtain more than 5 megapixel capability.  The wider angle and longer telephoto lens was also a plus. The lever action would be a reasonable alternative to the buttons for adjusting the focal length, but the action is so fast that adjustments are too great to properly use the lenses capabilities.The lens performs well optically, but it does not have threads for a protective or other filter.  More importantly, it has only two aperture settings.  This reduces the camera to using variable image sensor sensitivity instead of f-stops: fixed ISO settings are impossible in Auto, SR Auto, Natural Light, Panorama, Movie (of course), and Shutter Priority modes.  It also eliminates all but the most rudimentary ability to control depth of field.The view finder suffers from chromatic aberration, though the problem does not appear in the final image.  The diopter adjustment has been removed making the view finder making it difficult to use for those of us who wear glasses.The shutter response is agonizingly slow rendering the camera unfit for candid shots, animals, sports, and many other types of photography.  Unless the subject is fixed, getting the timing right is pure luck.Unlike the S5200, the camera does not have a manual focus.  This may be important to some, but I confess I almost never used the feature on the S5200.Yes, image quality is excellent.  If you want to take pictures of landscapes, architecture, and similar pictures, the camera is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: M. Cheshire "you bet yer ace"
Reviews.Content: This camera is definitely competition for my SLR and Fujifilm did an excellent job designing this camera.  If you are considering purchasing an SLR but don't want the ridiculous price tag still associated with them, I highly recommend you buy this camera instead.  The picture quality is every bit as good as my SLR, the camera is smaller, and the camera takes AA batteries (a real bonus compared to the cameras which require very expensive proprietary batteries).  For the amateur, this camera has an awesome auto exposure setting where the camera will decide the best settings for each shot and it works flawless.  You will sacrifice a bit of speed for this function, but the picture quality is worth it for those unfamiliar with manual settings (which you can still use once you get used to them).  My only complaint is that they didn't need to make the flash a flip version... It could have been built into the same space it flips up from.  Other than that, this camera is every bit the professional's tool as any overpriced SLR.  Those who wish to argue can provide me the difference in their pictures taken on both.  You won't see a difference warranting the SLR's price tag.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this camera. Takes great pictures at high resolution thus the pictures are of great quality. I have never used as a video camera since I have other camcorders so I can not speak to that aspect. But for a great still camera at a reasonable price I would certainly recommend this camera. Very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Abby Dearth
Reviews.Content: Great starter camera.  Takes wonderful pictures.  My daughter has gotten a lot of use from it.  Has a manual mode for learning how to use a lot of the settings on a bigger and more expensive camera.  Used on camera class and learned a lot without having to have a $1000 setup.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm FinePix S1800 12.2 MP Digital Camera with 18x Wide Angle Optical
Reviews.Author: Joyce Jordan "book lover"
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd Fujifilm FinePix camera and I have been very pleased with it.  It is lightweight and easy to use but also has many options to use in taking photos using both automatic and manual features.  It uses AA batteries which are easy to acquire as opposed to special battery packs.  I have been very pleased with the quality of the photos and the zoom capability on it.  When I did have to send it to a Fuji repair facility, the repair was done quickly and I have had no problems since then.

Reviews.Title: Durable. Great quality. Love!
Reviews.Author: L.A.Webb
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for almost 4 years now and it still works great! I would this camera recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Lasted almost 3 years
Reviews.Author: Nell
Reviews.Content: We bought this for Christmas in 2010 and it stopped working this summer. Have taken it to a camera repair shop and they said it was not worth repairing. We don't think we "broke" it, dropped it or anything. A throwaway purchase that should have lasted longer. However it was a good size and took nice quality photos for non-photo takers. Especially liked the panoramic feature.

Reviews.Title: A good little camera for the cost!
Reviews.Author: WLPIV
Reviews.Content: My wife wanted a digital camera, and it was after Xmas, so money was tight! I went onto Amazon, and I found a good little digital camera, at a reasonable price! The Fujifilm FinePix S1800 has all the features she wanted, was compact, and light weight. You definitely get your money's worth comparing this camera to others with similar features. It would be a wise purchase if you're in the market for a compact digital camera.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera, price low
Reviews.Author: William Yunda
Reviews.Content: Very good camera, the price is low but the camera take a good photos.Good scenes and a high zoom

Reviews.Title: Best for the price
Reviews.Author: C Rod
Reviews.Content: I love the price of the camera and love the quality of the pictures comes up. I love it and do not need to charge since have to include battries.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: customer
Reviews.Content: looked awesome and worked just fine and price was great, quality was great too, would purchase from again in future

Reviews.Title: Just the thing
Reviews.Author: Lavonne W. Pistole
Reviews.Content: Light and compact, and takes great pictures.  Undervalued in my opinion, although I WAS glad to get it at that price.  :)

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: hector alejandro muñoz moyano
Reviews.Content: I put this rate will not have problems to receive.I liked what I came quickly and without details, I have no complaintswould recommend it to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed....
Reviews.Author: Laura Butts "Bennett, Murphy and Jack are my ...
Reviews.Content: I have had nothing but problems since I received this camera.  After two years, the power button no longer works.  I have to remove the batteries to power down.  I also have realized that I cannot retrieve any photos off of the camera.  I have a call into Fuji to see if they will help resolve the problem.  It really has been a lemon of a camera though.  Even picture quality was poor.

Reviews.Title: CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Cliff Allen
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures and priced right,has all the options I was looking for.Would recommend to anyone. Have taken alot of pictures and all look good

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Glad
Reviews.Content: Good for the price, have a nice size, a good zoom and Bad quallity on the video mode. But it works,

Reviews.Title: Digital camera
Reviews.Author: john coleman
Reviews.Content: Very good quality, has been used many times always does good job, no problem whatsoever. PRICE WAS VERY GOOD!Glad I made the purchase.

Reviews.Title: It's does the job
Reviews.Author: D. Meulen
Reviews.Content: It works really well. I just wish I could figure out how to record a longer video. But because I couldn't I bought a camcorder. It does take beautiful still images though.

Reviews.Title: A Good Value
Reviews.Author: Dragoslav T. Marcovich
Reviews.Content: I happen to be a fan of Fujifilm (own 4 cameras) and I find Fujililm's pseudo-SLR a very good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: SR "SR"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a few years now and I think it's amazing. I wanted something more advanced than a regular point and shoot camera but didn't want to spend the money on one of the more expensive models because I'm not a major photographer. I just wanted something nice for when I go on vacations. The camera takes clear photos, has a great zoom, and many settings to choose from depending on the type of photo you're taking.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: agustin iglesia
Reviews.Content: muy buen producto. rapido facil y a tiempo la entrega. sin contratiempos en todo el proceso. lo recomiendo a a

Reviews.Title: Was a Christmas gift for my daughter
Reviews.Author: Robert M
Reviews.Content: This camera was a Christmas gift for my daughter who takes a lot of nature phots. She absolutely loves it. Good buy.

Reviews.Title: this was a gift
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Bell
Reviews.Content: This was bought for my daughter-n-law for Christmas and so far she loves it. We get to see videos and photos with good quality posted to facebook of our grandkids now!

Reviews.Title: Great pictures, but cheap construction.
Reviews.Author: Joshua Shining
Reviews.Content: This camera made me happy for a year. Then one day, I hit the button to discharge rechargeable batteries and that's when the engine that moves the lens decided to die. I haven't found anyone capable of fixing it and buying the part is half the price of a new camera. It's ornamental now.

Reviews.Title: Too Many Limitations
Reviews.Author: Lalani
Reviews.Content: I like small cameras. This one is too big for me. It does  not have rechargeable batteries so you have to worry about the batter running out. It does have an eye piece and thats important. It can handle higher capacity memory cards as well. I only use it as a back up whenmy Canon Powershot SD600 cameras are not suitable for making a longer video.

Reviews.Title: Great camera but,
Reviews.Author: Mercury
Reviews.Content: Great camera. ive had it for about 2 years and love it. perfect combination of a point and shoot and a dslr.BUt,  seeing a price now for $999.99?????? must be a typo.  I HOPE SO anyway;. I paid about 160.00. GOod camera but not for $999.99!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: I DID love it, but...
Reviews.Author: mismatch
Reviews.Content: I am amending my review from great to not great. The reason it's not great is because after just barely a year, it kept reading something about a card error, I kept missing great shots, and it was beyond the return date. It took great photos, but wasn't worth the $ for only 1.5 years.

Reviews.Title: Excelent camera!
Reviews.Author: J. Arevalo
Reviews.Content: I have this camera since dic '11 and i have to say that is awesome. Good price/product rate. In manual mode you can get nice pictures. If you are a photography enthusiast and dont want to expend a big amount of cash in a DSLR camera, this is the perfect fit for you.I recommend this cam as I use it for sightseen pictures and still nature pictures, but is good enough for any kind of situations. Just put the right set and you'll get awesome pictures.The only thing that annoys me is the way you get back to cam mode when you are in preview mode. You must press the shutter button rather than the play button. When you press the play button there is a annoying message that says something like "Press the shutter button" and the cam is locked for about 2 or 3 seconds.PROS:- All settings can be changed in Manual mode.- Good presetings for certain situations.- Good flash- Macro and SuperMacro are great.- Battery lasts long as it uses 4 AA batCONS:- Not-to-fast focus and shutter.- Electronic View Finder(EVF) is not good enough as an optical VF.

Reviews.Title: very happy
Reviews.Author: Chrisopher S. Sorsdahl
Reviews.Content: Great pics, easy to use, good battery life, light weight. What else could you want? And was cheaper then anything around here.

Reviews.Title: VERY good beginner camera, excellent macro!
Reviews.Author: Bobby Brighto
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in December 2010. Being my first camera, I wanted something that could take very good shots of small animals and reptiles, as well as my artwork.After a little over a year with this camera, I've found some faults.1. I have used the super macro setting with perfect lighting, on full zoom or no zoom, yet no matter how close or far I am, if the subject (insect, reptile, flower) is under 3" or so, it will come out noisy and the color will be off. I see little to no difference between macro, and super macro, other than not being able to use the flash, or full zoom optical  on the super. Not a problem for things larger than 3", such as mice and large birds/insects, they usually come out clear and defined if used in proper light and the correct settings.2. The "specialized" settings, such as sport, low light/fireworks, party, beach, and sunset, are not as significant as they seem. You can do better on "custom" mode, and change the settings as you go. All that those fancy settings do, is what you could do manually, and it comes out better if you do it yourself. Even worse, you can not control the light, ISO, or size you want to photo to be. The only setting I am fond of in that section is "flower" in which case they do come out slightly more vivid and the background is wonderfully blurred.3. The digital zoom is NOISY. I can almost guarantee, no matter what setting you have it on, even with a tripod, the photos will be grainy and blurry. And if this is a moving object, forget about definition and contrast, it comes out overly bright or dark, and the shutter takes forever to actually take the picture.4. Color is decent, if you have it on the right settings, and in perfect light. If you want nighttime photos, please use flash. Without it, the photos are overly red, blurred, and grainy.5. The auto (which I have used once, just to see) is very poor. I try never to use it, just because you are capable of so much more when you edit the settings yourself. Auto is for quick snapshots, and only if you do not care about quality, they are washed out and not to the camera's full capability.6. The movies are great, in good lighting. However, you can not focus while you are shooting, it auto focuses, often leaving you a few seconds of a blurry subject. There is no light correction, special features, or stabilization. You literally point and shoot. An example can be found here:[...] and [...]Lots of grain mentioned? Yes, even with 12.2 MP and low ISO, it still takes grainy photos over 400 speed.This is a very nice camera for the beginner and intermediate. Editing is usually a must. However, although I am in not a professional photographer, and do not have the terminology of one, I am an semi-professional artist, in which case I need spectacular reference photos for my artwork, with excellent color accuracy, contrast, and little or no grain/noise. I shoot with the lowest ISO I can manage, usually 64 to 200 MAX. I am looking to upgrade to a DSLR, or higher quality PnS very soon, but I highly recommend this camera for anyone who wants to take nice "around the house" shots. I am very pleased with this product!

Reviews.Title: more than I expected
Reviews.Author: Randolph Lee
Reviews.Content: It is great if you want a good light weight for beginners or professional camera. I love it. Many more features than I expected, best indoor pictures that I have ever seen. I love this camera, I haven't stopped photographing since I opened the package. fun times

Reviews.Title: Not as good as Fuji's Finepix S5200 5.1 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: D. Astley "Bleu"
Reviews.Content: In February 2007 we  purchased a Fujifilm Finepix S5200 5.1MP Digital Camera with 10x Optical Zoom.  I loved this camera.  It was my go to camera for stills and videos.  Easy to use and easy to get into, i.e., removing memory card, changing batteries.  Then it stopped working earlier this year.  So we ordered a new Fuji Finepix because we had liked the original one so much.First the pros:1. This camera has a wider viewing screen.  Love the viewing screen.2. A little bit lighter in weight.3. Uses an SD card.  Love the SD card.  Our original Fuji used an XD card.Cons and this is a big one for me:1. The wonderful SD card and the batteries are in the same spot.  Once that cover is off, both the batteries and the card are exposed.  You think, "So what's the big deal?"  The big deal is that sometimes -- not just sometimes but frequently even though I am careful, the batteries come out too.2. The cover holding in the batteries and the SD card is difficult to remove.Overall, the camera is just not as user friendly for me.  My family has noticed that my enthusiasm for pictures and movies has  gone down.  They might be breathing a sigh of relief, but this model of Fuji has not been an improvement for me.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Lindsey Chiswell Cruz
Reviews.Content: I just love this camera. We decided to upgrade from a point and shoot but didn't want to have to pay an arm and a leg to get a nicer one. This is just perfect. It has so many features we still haven't figured them all out, but at the same time it is easy enough to play with and get pretty decent shots. I would completely recommend this camera to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Easily the best camera that I have ever owned!
Reviews.Author: gregorywurz
Reviews.Content: I like to take pictures, but I don't have that great of an understanding about aperture, F-stops, and ISO settings.  I have generally had point and shoot cameras and only experimented with these functions if they were available.However, the one feature that had always been lacking was a good zoom!
