Every camera I had left me wanting for a better zoom capability.Then I got the Finepix S1800.The 18x zoom is great for most of my needs,although someday I do hope to have a DSLR with tons of great lens options.  This camera has given me the ability to expand the distance that I am able to take clear pictures from.The pictures that this camera takes are clear and colorful.  The different shooting moods for different types of scenes really come in handy.The only real drawback that this camera has is that it is somewhat bulky, so you almost always have to carry it around your neck (unless you have a camera bag).I did a lot of research before I bought this camera and, for the price, this is the best camera that you can get.  This camera has made me want to figure out all of the other manual functions that cameras have so I have enrolled in a digital photography class!I would recommend this to anybody who is looking for a low-cost, High quality camera, whether they are professional or just leisure photographers.

Reviews.Title: Decent camera with sub-par high ISO
Reviews.Author: Umi
Reviews.Content: I have been shooting with the camera for about 8 months. I purchased it as a stepping stone to a dSLR, and most often shoot in manual mode. For $200, I think the super zoom lens is pretty awesome. zoom is reasonably quick, and despite the barrel/pincushion distortion at either ends of the zoom range, it does very solidly in the middle range. The barrel distortion on the wide end is actually a bit fun when you get used to it (though technically undesirable) and the pincushioning isn't enough to be a real problem. The super-macro setting is brilliant - this lens focuses criminally close. Although this isn't "true macro", it's still pretty dang awesome.This is the first camera I have shot in manual mode, so I have some gripes that may be considered normal on a camera of this level. The aperture can only be set to one of two settings at any zoom range - which means that you do not have full control. The Electronic Viewfinder (used for when it's light out so you can avoid staring at a screen with glare) is almost nauseating because of the slight lag. The little screen in there is also very mediocre. A lack of a "B" function for the shutter is a bit annoying, but also something I guess I hsould expect from a camera like this.The high iso capabilties of the camera are near-nonexistent. I see very bothersome graininess coming in at even ISO 400. That means it's hard to take photos in even slightly dark situations without the flash, which is extremely bothersome. I especially like taking night shots, and end up taking most photos at ISO 100 or 200 with a tripod at 8" exposure and maximum aperture.This camera is also BIG. If you're planning on getting more into photography, I would look at other options. Smaller compacts will allow you to carry the camera with you in your pocket, which is a great learning tool (always have a camera with you!). This won't fit in a pocket, but will take up some awkward chunky space in the corner of a bag. remember that size isn't everything - the canon G11 will sprint circles around this camera but is significantly smaller. If you're a soccer mom trying to take shots of the kids in daylight, or into macro photography and don't want to shell out the $1000 setup, this camera may be in the running.

Reviews.Title: i was let down
Reviews.Author: hopefulconsumer
Reviews.Content: i bought this camera as an "upgrade" and that turn out bad.this camera is a total letdown.The images are good, but theirs blue dots all over the screenwhen your in a darker area or when something is black. these blue dots are very annoying!

Reviews.Title: A real nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Doug
Reviews.Content: This was bought as a gift, but I know for a fact that the recipient absolutely loves it, so I think it's safe to recommend  :-)

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Kallie
Reviews.Content: This item was purchased for my daughters 16th birthday. It was cost effective and has great features.  She uses it almost everyday.  I would recommend for anyone looking for a similar camera without the expense.

Reviews.Title: Order came fast
Reviews.Author: Cynthia Dodds
Reviews.Content: Did not like the back screen. It did not show a clear picture. When pic's were printed they were clear. Would like to see them fix the quality of back screen. Order came fast and was good quality.

Reviews.Title: FinePix S1800
Reviews.Author: Lvant
Reviews.Content: GREAT camera.  I was looking for a step up from the ordinary point and shoot camera, but a SLR was not in my price range - this camera is perfect! TONS of features and manual controls and takes beautiful pictures, so you can get the feel of an SLR without the huge price tag. I definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: This camera is for amateur photographers who can't afford a DSLR
Reviews.Author: Look-N-Grin
Reviews.Content: Pros: Everyone thinks it's a DSLR, it's 12.2 megapixels, HD video, 18x zoom, small and compact, big LCD screen, has a electronic viewfinder, advanced settings, self explanatory buttons, cheap price, great macro shots, autofocus and zooms while filming, uses double A batteries I'm safe if my camera dies, shutter speed for light graffiti, you can put lens filters using an adapter on itCons: I have to buy a lot of batteries, not good for people who know nothing about photography, the quality of pictures is a hit or miss, no official lenses or filters made by fujifilm

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: MHK
Reviews.Content: Really great camera, especially for the price! Have been using the S1800 for a few weeks now and I am still learning my way through the many features. I like the triple exposure mode as I do most shooting outdoors and the light can be tricky sometimes. Three different exposures give you a better chance at the optimum contrast and shading. A wish list would be for faster processing and photo editing software included with the camera, the FinePix viewer does load and file photos on my pc.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm FinePix S1800 12.2 MP its good for me
Reviews.Author: Fernando
Reviews.Content: I not a photographer and this camera is very good for me, take a good pictures in the night, awesome pictures on the day, the zoom is really fine =D, only the video clip is bad good video quality but audio is terrible.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, great price.
Reviews.Author: DarkPoet
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera along with a carrying case, 16 gig memory card, tripod, lens cleaning kit, and a few other goodies. The price, including shipping, was $199. The camera, while slightly bulky, is very lightweight and a snap to operate; very user-friendly. There's an instruction manual that comes with it, but unless you're a complete idiot, you won't need it.The picture quality is quite good, however, with the lens at max zoom, pictures can be slightly blurry. This camera is loaded with features, and pretty much does everything for you. Auto focus, blink detection, smile detection, auto-stabilization, etc. etc. I also have a Sony Cybershot 10 MP with a 10x zoom, and it cost $30 more.So to sum it up, 12.2 MP, 18x zoom lens, lightweight, tons of features, extremely easy to operate, all for around 160 bucks ($185 if you buy the value bundle). The Fuji S1800 is in my humble opinion, the best bang for the buck, mega-zoom camera on the market.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Alvaro
Reviews.Content: The only down side is the life of battery, but its is a great camera for the price, you dont have to spend too much time learning how to use it.

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: W. Schmittle
Reviews.Content: I've had the camera about 3 weeks and it takes great pictures, but impossible to view the screen outside.  You have to use the view finder to take a picture.  The battery door is very hard to open, and the worse problem is it won't accept a SD memory card unless its a Fugi or San Disc card.  I have a HP, and two other brands and none will work in the camera, plus the stupid fact that the internal memory only allows you to take 4 pictures.  Ridiculous!!!!  Anyhow, wish I had known about the low internal memory and card problem before I purchased the camera.  Would have thought twice.

Reviews.Title: This camera takes wonderful pictures!
Reviews.Author: Shafelly
Reviews.Content: I love how this camera takes awesome photos! No problems so far. A lot of people say the batteries don't last long but just throw some rechargeable batteries (Li-ON, NiMH) in there and it will last for a long time. This is a bridge camera, meaning it shares some of the attributes with a DSLR, but its a regular digital camera; I would say a hybrid camera.  The macro mode is awesome if you know how to use it.  If you like tweaking photos to specs, then I would suggest this camera for you :)

Reviews.Title: A great buy
Reviews.Author: gama5551
Reviews.Content: What a great camera for the price. Way more than just a point and shoot. This camera makes it easy to take great pictures you will be proud to share with friends and family. This is the best buy I have made in a long time.

Reviews.Title: Impressed so far
Reviews.Author: Susan L. Murphy
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera just prior to leaving for vacation, so I didn't have very much time to get familiar with it prior to leaving. I really liked the few options that I did figure out.  My only complaint right now is that the camera software was not compatiable with Windows 7, which I have on my computer, so I wasn't able to view the tutorial. It would have been nice to view some of the optional setting with out having to read the whole manual.I am looking forward to getting to know how to use all the different settings.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm FinePix S1800 12.2 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: J Bumgarner
Reviews.Content: Wonderful camera for the price.  I can't say enough about it.  I'm so glad I didn't overlook it among all the cameras I've seen on Amazon and in stores.

Reviews.Title: Keep looking
Reviews.Author: bgenuine2self
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera even though I had read some negative reviews.  I have an older version of this same camera, which had been a very good camera for me.  I just wanted something new with a little more zoom.The first real negative about this camera is that the lens cover does NOT stay on.  The cover just barely sits on the lens & pops off with the slightest movement!  The quality of the pics is fair.  The video,  when on zoom is not very good & the sound quaility is poor.I am hoping that I can return the camera & get my money back & either look for another camera or just keep my old one!

Reviews.Title: Awsome camera!
Reviews.Author: no professional photographer
Reviews.Content: I am definitely not a professional photographer.  I wanted an upgrade from my 10 year old Olympus.  I reviewed several cameras online and for the price and features decided on the Fugifilm FinePix S1800.  I have grandchildren and love to snap pictures of them so this camera is the right choice for me.  I like the fact that it is light weight.  Already have taken some very good shots of one grandchild playing basketball. I'm looking forward to learning more about all the features. So far I have not been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality LCD. Dead after two months of light use.
Reviews.Author: R. Fed "BFED"
Reviews.Content: I spent hours researching and reviewing for the right camera under $200 and picked the S1800.  I was initially disappointed to see a very grainy/noisy LCD and viewfinder which is comparable to a digital camera from 5-10 years ago.I was eager to utilize the many offered features but two months after very light usage the camera died completely and will not power up at all.  I have no idea what caused it and now I have to deal with contacting FUJI service which I'm sure will be very time consuming.Update 2/15/2013:  The replaced camera is still running strong after the abuse my wife and kids put on it.  Still captures nice and pretty images.  The only real drawback is still poor LCD resolution and color, especially for previewing pictures you just took. I really have no idea if I took a good picture until I open it on my computer.

Reviews.Title: awsome
Reviews.Author: carson
Reviews.Content: this is one of the best cameras Ive owned great price great pics large screen i love the fact it has a veiw finder for sunny days im sure you will be overjoyed to own this product!!!

Reviews.Title: Extremely pleased
Reviews.Author: gs
Reviews.Content: I have just rec'd this new camera and I have to admit that for the price I really was not expecting much. However I have to admit that I am very pleasantly surprised. This is the first Fugi I have ever owned and I was afraid that it was going to be way to complicated and not user friendly. This is definately not the case. The FinePix S1800 is a great camera that is really easy to use and takes geat pictures. I am not a pro and I wanted a really good quality camera that was simple to learn and easy to use. And that is EXACTLY what I got. Very pleased and would definately buy again. A+++

Reviews.Title: Very happy with this camera
Reviews.Author: Fabio
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my daughter as one of her electives in high school is photography and film and she is extremely happy with the camera, she is so happy with it that no one else is allowed to touch it, the pictures she has taken are great.Oh and I couldn't have been happier with the price, that camera to purchase in Australia is $300 and picked it from Amazon for $163(inc shipping.Thank you very much Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing Camera
Reviews.Author: AMcMillan
Reviews.Content: Do not buy this camera unless you have lots of time to spend troubleshooting and contacting Fujifilm, which will get you nowhere. Pictures, regardless of the setting, come out blurry and grainy- too much noise that cannot be fixed by changing shutter speed or ISO. Fujifilm has a terrible automated system, which will lead you to want to smash the camera! They will try and tell you to fix everything on the camera, while hinting that it may just be a faulty focus sensor and will need to be sent in for repair. I believe there is a problem with this model. It's a dud. We purchased a fujifilm, because our older s5000 took beautiful pictures with no problem. Not only will I be returning this camera, I will be switching brands entirely.Novice or amateur, do yourself a favor and go with something else.

Reviews.Title: Not bad for refurbished
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Swift
Reviews.Content: I got this for a great price because it was refurbished. I'm not sure exactly what was refurbished, it came looking brand new. Takes pretty good pictures, I really haven't had a chance to really use it yet. I will update this review when I can put some time into it.

Reviews.Title: Great photos, bad video.
Reviews.Author: David M. Johnson "Septa"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for two years. I've taken thousands of photos, and it was a tremendous upgrade from my previous FujiFilm camera. However, there are some definite pros and cons about the camera.Pros: While not a small camera by today's standards, it is a convenient size. I've never had any trouble carrying it on trips. The photos are great, even at full zoom. I've taken a lot of photos of people, wildlife and nature. It's not the best in low-light scenarios without a tripod, but that is something you'll see with most cameras. I've received many comments about the quality of the photos I take. The camera will also pick up bright stars and can photograph the moon.Cons: There is a distinct "clicking" noise in videos if you zoom in or out during recording. You may have trouble uploading videos directly from the camera if they're too large. The auto-shooting dial to switch between settings will alternate between Auto and Scene Selection without the dial being touched. This can cause you to lose focus on a shot and have to re-focus. This started happening after about a year of use. After two years of use, the zoom button started malfunctioning.Overall, it is a good camera. The photos are great, but the hardware does not stand the test of time. I would not recommend the camera, unless you're on a strict budget. I would not re-purchase the camera.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm FinePix S1800 12.2MP Digital Camera w/18x Zoom.
Reviews.Author: Jayman "J. Williams Photography"
Reviews.Content: I normally don't leave reviews about any of the products I purchase. However, this one deserves it. This is the first time I've ever used a Fujifilm brand camera and I must say, it's got what it takes if you know what your doing. It's set up for both, basic users and advanced users. I personally am a photographer and normally use multiple cameras for different setups and that's the main reason I have purchased the Fujifilm FinePix S1800 after reading more than 50 other reviews about it. However, do not go by the photographs that some have stated they took with this camera. These photographs are stock photo's from the original website and was taken from the Fujifilm FinePix S2800HD camera and it is a little more expensive. I own now the Fujifilm FinePix S1800,S2550HD, and the S2800HD. Don't waste your money on the S2550HD-only difference is the HD quality and if you have the skills you can get the same quality from the s1800, and the only difference with the s2800 is the HD quality and the mega pixel. I as a photographer would not use 14.2 mega pixels to shoot quality photos. Now I have some issues to state about the S1800. I don't like the fact that it's more than 150.00 after tax and don't have the option to set other lens on it, I own a cheaper brand that I paid 89.00 for and it has many different lens options. This is a downer on such a nicely set up camera. However, it does have the Super Marco which is great. I don't like how slow it is to transfer the photos to the computer, I am fast paced and this slows me down a lot. It's feel is off, meaning it feels grungy. The texture on the camera is bubbly and is hard for me to get used to. Another problem I found is the cameras stability control, it works, but it don't. I suppose if you had a very windy day and your camera was moving very fast and as if it was almost trying to fall over than it works good. I tested it and had to move it fast and side to side more than an inch to make it work on both stability control settings. This is poorly set. The photos are high quality though and that's a plus. Note: Do not use Alkaline batteries if you are doing photo shots, you'll be replacing them every 10-15 min. I use rechargeable 2900mAh batteries and they get me through at least 2 days if I happen to forget to charge them each day. I take photos all day long this camera should have the option to use AC/DC power pack. But it don't. Over all rating is 4.0 of 5. It does it's job and some.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I wanted
Reviews.Author: david decelis
Reviews.Content: First of all I am a casual photographer  - I do not consider myself a PRO!This is my 5th digital camera and I can strongly affirm that for its price, this is a good buy.PROSLike the gripExcellent ZoomPhotos taken on 'AUTO' are 99 per cent of good qualityLight when considering sizeI put in Lithium batteries - seems to last foreverDisplay 3inch  - ultra clearLike the Panorama featureVery effective anti shake featureConsdo not like the lens capa bit bulky compared to a compact

Reviews.Title: My Christmas Camera!
Reviews.Author: B. Bayer "Babs"
Reviews.Content: I was in need of a new camera and all the point and shoots I was getting were not taking the best quality pictures that I wanted. I'm not a  professional but my hobby is picture taking. I take pictures all time of my family and scenery. Any who I have a Nikon point and shoot and was not happy with it. So We are on a tight budget I had to find myself a camera with some ginger.I found this camera here on Amazon and when read all the awesome reviews I told my hubby I think this might be the one. I opened it on Christmas morning and used it. Right away I could clearly see the difference in quality of my pictures. WOW what a difference. The pictures are crystal clear. I already had some of the pictures I took blown up to anywhere from a 5x7 to 11x11 and all my enlargements came out excellent.I post a lot of pictures on my facebook page and you can see the differences between both cameras. I get so many more compliments on my new shots I had taken verses the old one.I'm very very happy with this product and if your on a budget like we are and cant afford the SLR cameras, give this one a try.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase for a Great Price!
Reviews.Author: trish
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing!  I love the shutter and panaorama features.  I have a toddler so it's great to capture what I want before he moves!

Reviews.Title: Fuji Camera
Reviews.Author: K P
Reviews.Content: I assume I was getting a great camera for the price. However the photos quality didnt come out as expected. They were blurred and not good clarity at all. The instructions dont give enough detail on how to take good pictures. Overall I was not satified with this camera. My son left it here when he went back to college and decided to stick with his regular digital camera.

Reviews.Title: A good camera
Reviews.Author: Adrián
Reviews.Content: Actually I quite like and I think he has very good price for the features of the camera. I like the quality of the photos that I can accomplish. The only thing is heavy ", however, as I am not a professional photographer is not decisive. I do not regret buying at all, and the store service was excellent. Greetings

Reviews.Title: Glad I bought it!
Reviews.Author: ANButeau
Reviews.Content: I was super excited to get this camera! I had a 5mp canon and I really wanted to take better pictures.. I'm a little spoiled in the fact that I get to use my mom's Rebel XSTi so I am always comparing the pictures I take with her camera to mine. but for a point and shoot it's great. Really easy to use and I get to change settings as I see fit. The best part is the macro. It has an amazing macro capability.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, but don't move!
Reviews.Author: Tyler Acampora
Reviews.Content: This is overall a great camera, and you can't beat it for the price. The 12 megapixles take fantastic photos if your subject isn't moving at all. I take photos of people who are skateboarding, or rollerblading, and it is almost impossible to use in those situations because the shutter isn't fast enough. Although in every other situation this surpasses every task you throw at it. The stills are fantastic like I said. The video features are great also, but the only issue with that is it doesn't auto focus. Whenever I try to take video, the HD is amazing and everyone I know is impressed by it, but when you move the camera while recording, it goes out of focus and it takes a while to catch up, and there is no way to do it manually. I absolutely love the panoramic mode and for $150 I would buy the camera simply for that. In the end its a great camera and the HD is great minus not being able to focus correctly and the slow shutter speed I would recommend this to anyone any day. Also all the other Fuji S-Models are almost the same as this in every way just a more expensive price, so if you want a Fuji S-Class get this because all the others are almost the same just cost more. If you want to see some videos taken with this camera go to[...] All the videos except "Epic Garage Skating" are the Fuji.

Reviews.Title: Great value for price
Reviews.Author: tansi golfer
Reviews.Content: I especially like having an optical viewfinder to use when bright sunny days make the LCD screen hard to see.  Also like having an 18x zoom.  I am looking forward to using the camera on upcoming trips.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera For HQ Picture
Reviews.Author: ANAND SINGH BIDAWAT
Reviews.Content: Fujifilm FinePix S1800 really combines all the best in one of the other. I bought it for my brother who is engineering. The 18X zoom is awesome!! It puts me right on top of things. The face recognition and red eye removal software is also cool.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera and great value
Reviews.Author: Phillip
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera a few weeks ago and I am very happy I did.It takes great photos and has more options than I will probably ever use.As a point and shoot it is good and takes clear photos.I especially like the manual shooting modes as I can set the image exactly as I wish.All in all a great camera.Recommended!

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT!
Reviews.Author: steelejeff
Reviews.Content: I have gone from camera to camera for a few years now and this camera is excellent. It has a huge zoom and the pictures are surpassingly crisp and clear. BUY THIS CAMERA.

Reviews.Title: wonderful!!
Reviews.Author: marialita
Reviews.Content: wowww, i just love this camera! it takes great pictures with full rich color. I was having a hard time deciding on this one or a nikon, but omg really couldn't have made a better choice. LOVE it & u'll love it too!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Earl Stevens
Reviews.Content: If your upgrading from the point and click digitals, this is a great camera to buy. It is inexpensive, takes great photos, has quite a few of the functions as the higher priced cameras.

Reviews.Title: For the price, best product ever
Reviews.Author: Mateus
Reviews.Content: I've read a couple of reviews before buying it.Forget about the bad reviews. If you are professional, spend more money and buy a more sophisticated camera.If you love photos, but are not professional, but want more than a Sony cyber shot, here is where to go.The panoramic photo works great. You can use scenarios or customize bright, light exposure, and so on.I found it a great camera. The battery last a lot.If you are going to use alkaline don't to properly setup the camera.

Reviews.Title: Fuji Film Fine Pix review
Reviews.Author: Adrianna
Reviews.Content: The camera is very easy to use.It has a pretty good flash for a built in flash.The only thing i find a problem with it is you cant switch the lenses and i haven't found lens adapters for it.Other then that it has perfect quality.Overall i love the camera.

Reviews.Title: It's just a point-and-shoot, but a very good one
Reviews.Author: explorenorth
Reviews.Content: After decades as an SLR and DSLR user, I bought this camera during a trip after deciding I wanted something light and quick. For the price this is agreat little camera, but has some limitations. After shooting 9,000 photos with mine with no mechanical or other issues, the things that have me shopping again are:- lag - it takes a very long time to take a picture. Forget about sports or action shots.- on long telephoto shots you need a beanbag or tripod - there's just not enough mass or leverage to keep it steady.- it does a generally poor job with low light, although it occasionally surprises me (it does theatre well).- I really miss not being able to select much of anything, particularly ISO.It does, though, do the vast majority of what I want to do while traveling.

Reviews.Title: Camera Review
Reviews.Author: KMorgan
Reviews.Content: I actually really love the camera but, it goes through batteries like crazy.  The batteries that came with it lasted a decent amount of time.  When I put in new batteries they all died in like literally 5 minutes!  So I have gone and bought some of those lithium batteries and these seem better although I have not had any real time in using it since then.  I also am not using the big display screen and using the tiny one to help save battery life since 4 batteries run $10.  So we will see.  Lots of options and you will defiitely need to read the manual to learn all the little tricks it can do.  I am still learning.

Reviews.Title: the best deal ever
Reviews.Author: lou
Reviews.Content: It is a professional camera that can be used by beginners and always to obtain a spectacular photo. The price is excellent. Very good quality. I recommend the purchase. The zoom is really amazing.i love it

Reviews.Title: Great product.
Reviews.Author: Abner
Reviews.Content: Item was just as described. Very easy to use. I gave them as christmas gifts to our sons.  One son took his back to college with him, he loves it, so does his friends. My husband who has a cannon will borrow this from our other son instead of getting out his cannon. It is a great camera to transition between a point and shoot and a fully manual camera. I would have preferred a rechargeable lithium battery instead of the AA batteries it came with, we did purchase lithium AA batteries seperately, however my husband and sons are very happy with the extra batteries we purchased.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Richard Gratt "pak715"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for ghost hunting as I see they are removing the filters from these and calling this a ghost camera and charging $300.00+ shipping for it. This is a fantastic camera. I bought it new here from an amazon seller. Not too hard to use and captures great fotos in all conditions. Even comes with new batteries. Took about 30 night shots the first night and it takes awsome pictures. For a few bucks more give yourself peace of mind and buy a NEW one. Read your feedback on amazon before buying. I found out that the newer model is unreliable and this cheaper older model is actually better. Do your home work. Great camera!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Aimee &amp;amp;amp;amp;amp; Jim Farmer
Reviews.Content: For the price I don't think you can find a better deal. I bought this camera for my wife and we have enjoyed it very much. The picture quality is excellent and the zoom is absolutely amazing. The only negative I would have with it is the flash. On previous cameras the flash would pop up when needed. With this camera you need to make sure your flash is popped up (manually) and then it will use it if needed. This is a very negligible issue for us. Overall I would highly recommend this camera for anyone looking to step up from a point and shoot camera. It's even cheaper than some point and shoot camera's with many nicer features and high quality imaging.

Reviews.Title: Great camera but
Reviews.Author: mybrowneys
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, for the price... you just can't beat it!! However, there are a few things to get used to. If you want pics on the automatic mode, you will need to hold the shutter button down for several seconds before you take a pic. I have only come across this in dim light, however, in bright light it is awesome. I took several awesome pics of my kids in the snow with NO issues.The program for the computer in my opinion is a little flawed, but after much avail, I finally figured it out... I almost sent it back because of the program! Very tricky at first.Overall I am satisfied with the purchase, keep in mind what your paying to...

Reviews.Title: A picture's worth a thousand words...
Reviews.Author: Rick Burnham
Reviews.Content: ...if you could download one.As a very amateur photographer, I have generally enjoyed using this camera though it probably has more features than I need. I like the heft of it more than many of the little point and shoot variety and appreciate the ability to look through the veiwfinder as well as use the LCD. I would have to blame any less than perfect photos on my lack of photography skills rather than any deficiencies of the camera. Unfortunately, after less than a year of use, I have lost the ability to download pictures to my computer owing to what is described in a window of the FinePix software: I/O error occurred. Process aborted. Alas, I'm far away in Africa now and can't get a diagnosis of the problem. I would have liked to get to know this camera better before it failed on me.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: tpyrft
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my daughter as an upgrade. She has advanced well enough with her skills to move to what I feel is an intermediate device and the s1800 fills the bill. She's 15 and has a goal to become a pro. I support this which is why, after extensive research, I chose the Fugi s1800. You should be comfortable purchasing this camera. I was and still am.

Reviews.Title: SMILE!
Reviews.Author: Brian Brabazon "BebE"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my teen daughter who loves to take, send and post pictures. I've seen the pictures she has taken and the they are clear and crisp. She feels like a professional with this camera and for a dad who really can't afford much more than what the Fuji cost, it makes ME feel like a superhero. I shop Amazon and their suppliers a few times a year and I have NEVER been dissatisfied.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Millie B
Reviews.Content: I am an amateur when it comes to photography.  I like to take lots of pictures of my kids and activities, vacations, etc. but I don't have much technical knowledge of cameras or photography so pardon my terminology. I was looking for an upgrade to my Canon powershot A580 8MP 4x optical zoom but didn't want to spend the money on a SLR (or the time to learn how to use it!) This camera seemed to be a great fit for me based on all of the 5 and 4 star reviews that I read.  Plus I loved my first digital camera which was a Fujifilm S3000 3.2MP 6x optical zoom.  Video is an important feature to me because I don't want to also carry a camcorder around with me.I got the S1800 for Christmas and used it Christmas day through New Years Day.  Most of my pictures were in low light conditions which I know is worst-case.  The pictures were not good at all--they were fuzzy and dark.  The video quality was even worse.  The videos were dark and had lines of light throughout them. I admit that I did not play around with the different modes because I felt like the Auto mode (which detected which mode to use) should take good pictures. It seemed to do a good job of detecting the right mode but pictures just weren't good.  On New Years Day, I started using my Canon in the same conditions as the Fuji to compare them.  There was a huge difference, especially in video quality.  The Canon video was significantly brighter and had no lines.  The Canon pictures weren't exceptional but were much clearer and better quality overall than the Fuji.  I decided to not spend any more time trying to figure out how to improve its performance and returned it.It was a great price but quality was lacking.

Reviews.Title: Photos
Reviews.Author: KenW
Reviews.Content: When I received this camera I was able to use it right from the box.  The simple instructions made it easy to use almost all the features without studying them.  Even the ones that took a little longer were not that complicated to learn.  The telephoto feature is really amazing.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE THIS CAMERA!!!
Reviews.Author: El "lab"
Reviews.Content: This Camera is the perfect size and it is the perfect weight to just throw it in your purse and bring it ANYWHERE.. its bigger than the point and shoot cameras but it is a lot smaller than the Larger Cameras... I love it! It takes AMAZING pictures. It even detects if someone blinked and it fixes it instantly... absolutly worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: Happy Snapping
Reviews.Author: Camp Cook
Reviews.Content: The camera is excellent quality, especially for the price.  It takes clear pictures and amazing close up of subjects.  The only complaint that I have is that when zooming in while in the video mode it leaves a clear and distinct whirring noise on the sound track.  Other than that it is an excellent camera and I especially like that it is capable of using large capasity memory cards.

Reviews.Title: very pleased!
Reviews.Author: tgood
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my son, who is 19, and he absolutely loves it. He had been playing around with different cameras and is always taking pictures. I wanted to get him something he could operate manually and on auto. He loves how it fits in his hand, and the ease of taking pictures. Some of the features allow him to take quality photos that I wouldn't expect this little camera to produce. Like the panoramic feature, it's fantastic! I'm not a photographer, but the pictures that he has taken with this feature look perfect! like a professional took them! I believe this camera will keep him very happy. At least until he's mastered this one and ready for a bigger one! Even then I'm sure he'll always hang onto this one. I'm very satisfied that we got more than what we expected.

Reviews.Title: Love my new camera
Reviews.Author: Marisol
Reviews.Content: Great camera, very friendly with the user, I been taking great pictures, love the bracketing feature, has great colors,this is my first camera and I am very happy with what I got considering the price... I highly recommend this camera for people making first steps in photography. The camera is so light, small and handy. Dislikes: only has 2 levels of aperture, doesnt have the option to make b/w pic (at least I havent found it), need tripod for zoom, but in general terms, it's a great camera, you can snap snap snap, takes great macro photos! Ill rate it 5/5

Reviews.Title: Hopeful Amateur
Reviews.Author: Kendra Littlejohn "kmlittlejohn"
Reviews.Content: I'm still learning how to operate this thing.  With manual setting i get awful pictures.  On auto, they are decent.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera at a great price!
Reviews.Author: Anne C
Reviews.Content: Camera is easy to use! Started using it right out of the box. Seems to be a perfect little camera for those of us who are not pro's but want more than a strictly point and shoot. I would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: The Lako
Reviews.Content: This camera is so much fun. It arrived 4 days before it's scheduled delivery and also was just as Amazon described it. It is easy to use, has so many features and not to mention, is a wonderful price for what it does. I know that this is not the best of the other cameras on the market but it was worth the $149.00 that I paid for it. The pictures are great quality and the videos that it takes are great.If you are still new to taking pictures with a decent camera, then I would say this is a fantastic buy. It's low priced, great quality, and still small enough for your hands and small enough to fit in a jacket or purse/backpack.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera at a Perfect Price
Reviews.Author: Roxanne Young
Reviews.Content: Use this camera as a second camera during trips abroad. Just what I needed in a point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: Anne Brooks "Anne"
Reviews.Content: 17 year old grandson wanted the more expensive SLR cameras but it was out of this grandmothers price range. After looking over the reviews for this one I decided to purchase it. The grandson loves it and has had a great time using it along with the editing program I also purchased. You will not be disappointed with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Right price for the options available
Reviews.Author: lopergal "scappychic86"
Reviews.Content: I love to take a lot of pictures and this camera is at a price that is right for a camera with a lot of options.  The sports multishot works amazingly well.  I was impressed for the price, I didn't expect much - and my expectations were met and highly exceeded.

Reviews.Title: love this camera!
Reviews.Author: kurlykelli "kurlykelli"
Reviews.Content: I purchased 2 of these cameras for my twins. They absolutely love them! Picture quality is great and they like the scene selections. I will definitely recommend this camera to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Good digital camera
Reviews.Author: Daunte Steele "Dee"
Reviews.Content: Camera is small and lightweight. The noise when using the zoom feature in video mode is quite annoying but others have made the same comment.  The main reason I wanted the camera is the electronic view finder.  I have a point and shoot that works great but in bright sunlight, you can only point and hope you are getting the picture.  That feature is wonderful.  I will probably only use the auto mode option of the camera.  I am not a photographer and do not understand most of the other technical settings but the auto mode is just fine.

Reviews.Title: Recommended
Reviews.Author: D. Lorincz
Reviews.Content: This camera is doing well for me. I'm not one who makes lots of setting adjustments althought this camera has them. I'm a point and shooter and the auto setting and the video setting are working well for me. This camera was selected because of the 18 optical zoom. I want to take pictures of animals and birds at a distance. The professional reviews I read before purchase recommend a tripod when taking distance shots. So far that hasn't been practical. With tempuratures in the teens and twenties I've been taking long distance pictures at full zoom through the kitchen window over the sink with my arm braced and the pictures have been acceptable. Closer shots have been impressive. The camera has some sort of stabilizer in it; it will hesitate when taking a shot to lock in on the subject and get the clearest picture possible. It makes me look like I know what I'm doing. It's comfortable to hold. It was purchased just before Christmas, so I haven't yet taken the time to learn to use all the features. It looks as if there's lots of room to grow my picture-taking skills for a happy-snaps kind of photographer like me.

Reviews.Title: Best of the best point and shoot cameras
Reviews.Author: Michael L. Kouns
Reviews.Content: great Camera for near pro quality point and shoot opportunities. The added size over the traditional pocket point and shoot cameras is more than made up for by the quality of the pictures. Recommend highly

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the PRICE!
Reviews.Author: M. Snyder "ElectronGeek"
Reviews.Content: Great camera and right price! I bought it for Christmas to give to my Fiance! She loves the picture quality! She kind of stumbles at all the features it has and how to work them! But it just takes a little time to figure it out and she wont have any problem taking pictures. But she was taking pics pretty much right out of the box! Loaded batteries and she was off to the races on Christmas taking pictures of family. Amazon is a great place to buy almost everything. Thanks guys!

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm Fine Pix S1800 digital camera
Reviews.Author: Douglas W. Hensler
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with the camera and it is more than expected. The shipping was expedited quickly. This is my third digital camera and it is better than another brand I bought five years ago for over $900.

Reviews.Title: Great stuff
Reviews.Author: yhtak
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my daugter. it has great and easy steps for good pictures. it is llight and nice to hold.Sad part my daughter lost it in 48 hours.

Reviews.Title: A great buy!
Reviews.Author: Jim C.
Reviews.Content: We bought the camera as a Christmas gift for our 16 year-old son.  It has not left his hand since he opened it.  He has taken some great photos and is really pleased.

Reviews.Title: S1800 FujiFilm FinePix
Reviews.Author: Barry G. Brown "BB"
Reviews.Content: Wow...I sure surprised my wife with this awesome piece of photographic equipment.It takes SUPER photos, is easy to use or you can get complex with all of the different settings. A truly great buy.

Reviews.Title: Rechargable Battery is missing
Reviews.Author: David Kasradze "David K."
Reviews.Content: The camera is very nice, but please note that it has NOT rechargable batteries.  Otherwise camre is meeting expectations.

Reviews.Title: Blurry pics in every mode
Reviews.Author: Suz
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a step up from regular point and shoot cameras that always kept breaking.  I needed one with lots of features to take pics of my store inventory and to post pics online.  I read the entire manual twice before taking the camera out of the box and I was encouraged by the other reviews on here of the features and clear pictures.  Guess I got a bad camera because I used each feature on Christmas and more than half of my pictures are blurry and out of focus even in auto mode.  The problem is they appeared clear on the LCD screen so I didn't realize the problem until viewing them on the computer.  I'm very disappointed and will be returning this camera tomorrow.  I've use both film and digital SLRs and this is not a good deal at all.  I'll go back to the cheapies--no zoom, but at least the pics are clear.

Reviews.Title: Fuji S1800
Reviews.Author: TOM
Reviews.Content: Iam not a professional photographer, but I do my fair share of picture taking.  I bought the S1800 as a gift, and I can't keep my hands off it.  Has a great zoom and a list of features that are easy to use, that really add to the photo experience.  Overall, a great buy for the price.

Reviews.Title: Just what I expected
Reviews.Author: kc
Reviews.Content: I knew this was not going to be a "professional" quality type of camera.  I just wanted some nice looking pictures without going to a pro.  I got a great deal, but I got what I paid for.  I have a lot to figure out on the camera and that is a good thing.  I wanted more options, but not necessarily all the manual demands.  I don't mind it being more automatic.  I just want to push a button and click.  I viewed the pictures others had shared and I am excited to do some pictures like that.  I think I really will enjoy making my own, nice pictures.

Reviews.Title: Perfect bridge camera.
Reviews.Author: D. B. Glenn "Jazzydav"
Reviews.Content: This camera was bought for someone who didn't want an automatic digital one.It fitted the bill perfectly. There is enough manual control to feel you can control the shots,without being totally lost in science!! It is compact & the end results are very good.Perfect for a budding David Bailey!!

Reviews.Title: Bad Quality Pictures
Reviews.Author: Kristenyo
Reviews.Content: My parents gave me this camera for Christmas. I was excited because I've been wanting a more advanced camera than the standard $100 digital camera. I had to read the instruction manual because it was really confusing on how to work the camera, but then again I'm not experienced with multi-functionable cameras. I'm sure it's a really nice camera, but to get to the point, my iPhone 3G takes better pictures than this camera. I was so disappointed. If I used flash all my pictures came out severely brightened, which I hate. Especially if I'm taking a close-up, then everything is white. If I am not using flash, the pictures come out fuzzy and grainy. I thought maybe they would look better once I uploaded them to my laptop, but they looked as they appear on playback mode. Needless to say this camera was a real disappointment, and I am returning it as soon as possible to get a refund. What a waste of a Christmas present :/

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: bmho
Reviews.Content: If you are an amateur like me, who wants to step into the next level, this camera is the best for its price and features.

Reviews.Title: Fuji s1800- freezes
Reviews.Author: Mrfixit13662
Reviews.Content: Purchased this around Thanksgiving 2010 using it everyday. Few days ago it started to freeze on me after taking some pictures outdoors. Acted like it was trying to write to the card but would just hang, light would keep flashing yellow and green.  I am  starting to be disappointed.Had to take the batteries out to shut it off and then had to reset the camera. After doing this it worked, but for how long before it happens again.  Anyone else have this problem? I called Fuji and they said it sounded like the camera was malfunctioning. Asked me what card I was using, Sandisk SDHC class(4)4GB. Put the card in the reader and the picture file is there but shows empty.  Going to send it back to Amazon for a refund and look at buying another camera with features like this one.  I was starting to enjoy it very much.

Reviews.Title: Extremely good for the price you are paying
Reviews.Author: ashu
Reviews.Content: This product is not way less than Nikon or cannon in terms of features given. Though you can compare the size of nikon and cannon with cumbersome size of Fuji, but thats what differentiate amature from good photographer. thats what DSLR cameras also have/ On picture quality its good not the best but I still have to explore more features and become a good photographer, but self timer, auto mode and panaroma are wonderful.Someone who is just starting with camera and dont want to shell out $100  more for cannon or Nikon, buy this one. Stranegly but I liked the Alkaline AA batteries usability as whereever battery dies I can go buy new one and start and not like inbult camera where if it dies my adventure stops, it happened with my freind.Thanks

Reviews.Title: great camera so far...
Reviews.Author: theemmick5
Reviews.Content: I have only owned this camera for about 10 days, so I haven't yet had a chance to experience all of the options yet.  I'm not a professional photographer, just a picture-happy Mom with 3 little boys.  So far, the camera has proven to be very easy to use and the pictures are absolutely beautiful.  My only real issue is that I can't get the lens cap to stay on, it just falls right off.  That being said, I would recommend this camera based on its user-friendliness and beautiful pictures alone.

Reviews.Title: Second thoughts.
Reviews.Author: Katie
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing especially for the price. I however learned that in the aperture and manual or custom settings make the picture grainy, if it's not set appropriately or if I edit a picture on the aperture mode. I stick to the SP auto. It's much better.If I'm going out and taking pictures, then I have to carry around extra batteries. It'd be better if this thing came with a charger instead.I wish the f-stop was a bit more higher.For the price though, it's a pretty good deal.I am a beginner with this camera, it's a good start. I might regret wasting my money in the future though. I wish instead of this camera I bought a nikkon. Even though it's a bit more pricey.

Reviews.Title: Best camera for the money I've ever purchased.
Reviews.Author: Jeffery L. Clothier "SanityinDesMoines"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera just prior to a planned trip to Washington, DC. At a discounted price pf 150.00, and with the customer reviews I read, it seemed like solid value for the.money. I took over 400 photos with it that week, amd was more than pleased.I mostly kept it on Auto, so haven't scratched the surface of what it can do, bit even at that, the sharpness, clarity, are closer to a DSLR than a point-and-shoot in this price range. Evem got credible night shots on auto settings.The 18x optical zoom did not disapppiny except for the noise  it made when shooting video, which was more pronounced than I expected. Other than that, I am very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome value
Reviews.Author: R. Bailey
Reviews.Content: The Fujifilm s1800 is a great camera for its price. The camera takes very good quality photos and the 18x zoom is awesome. I'm still trying to learn the manual settings to take better photos but the auto setting seems to work very well. The camera is pretty well designed and easy to hold. It does not weigh too much... and any excessive weight is taken off by the shoulder strap which is nice. Overall, this camera is great for its cost and I would recommended it to anyone looking to get a DSLR-like camera for a very cheap price.

Reviews.Title: My second Fujifilm Finepix camera
Reviews.Author: Sharon Barrett Kennedy "artrageous"
Reviews.Content: This camera offers seriously big bangs for the bucks!  The telephoto lens is nothing short of amazing, and the super macro lens is superb.  I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars, however, for a couple of reasons:The first s1800 camera I ordered was defective and had to be returned.  It would freeze up when I was (rapidly) deleting images or sometimes when reviewing them.  Kudos to Amazon for a no-hassle return and quick replacement!The other reason for the 4 stars instead of 5 has to do with image quality in low-light settings; there were some things I could do very easily on the auto setting of my Finepix S5200 that just won't work with the s1800.  When I have time to really explore some of the built-in settings and take the time to learn more about manual settings, I think I'll be able to get the results I want (especially given the quality of images that other owners have shared).Overall, I'm very pleased with this camera and would recommend it to anyone who wants DSLR quality without paying a DSLR price!

Reviews.Title: never enough time
Reviews.Author: Jacob L. Garcia "ramrodjlg"
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong, this camera looks good and has a great price, but it takes way too much time to focus and take a picture or two. It is nearly impossible to take two focused pictures in a row. The picture that you do get to take focused do come out nice on the computer but the 3" viewer is very snowy.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: D. Mcclellan
Reviews.Content: Good all around camera with tons of options.  Once you get used to the 2 step snap of the shutter, it's great (push half way to focus, then all the way to take).  Otherwise it seems the shutter takes a long time to activate.

Reviews.Title: Very nice for the price
Reviews.Author: G. Jackson "bassplayer 59"
Reviews.Content: I'm no expert on cameras, so this is strictly my opinion and experience. For the price the camera is very nice and does what I need it to do. I did not want to lug my DSLR and a lenses around on a regular basis, so I bought this one. Thus far I am pleased and have no complaints. Unforntunately some people will compare this camera with much more expensive one's and give it a negative review. But all and all it's a good lightweight inexpensive camera that left me with a little money to buy the accessories that I needed. IMHO! :-}

Reviews.Title: My wonderful new camera
Reviews.Author: Laksmi González
Reviews.Content: It is a great camera, but I am a beginer with this kind of item and of course I have no experience with this quality of product, nevertheless the price is great for the kind of camera.

Reviews.Title: A nice step-up.....
Reviews.Author: A. R. Shirah
Reviews.Content: Like many, I was looking to upgrade, aren't we all? I saw many of my friends with these SLRs & DSLRs with these huge lenses hanging off of them and saw the results of these cameras and just knew I had to have one!  Until I saw the price...kinda took the wind out of my sail.  So, after about 1 month of research online, asking questions to SLR owners, and reading many reviews here (love Amazon!!), I decided on this one and I 'm so glad I did. In short, this camera does everything it says it does. Out of the box, it has a very sturdy feel to it, a rubber like grip makes it easy to hold on to. It is a bit light if you are used to lugging a bigger SLR. The point is, this is a very nice step up from the small P & S cameras. I'm very pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Definitely worth the money.
Reviews.Author: K
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing camera. It takes amazing shots for all kinds of different positions. I was surprised about the quality of these photos. You don't need a $3954838943974 camera. This one does the job just fine.

Reviews.Title: very satisfied
Reviews.Author: David Hodgkins
Reviews.Content: I am very satisfied with the camera. It takes a little getting used to but seems to take very good pictures

Reviews.Title: I like everything except....
Reviews.Author: Angie
Reviews.Content: I'm trying to get pictures of my kids incuding my 10 month old who moves before the picture takes every time. So all of my pictures are of the top of her head or her completely turning aound. How can I make the picture take faster with the flash? So far all of my pictures have been indoors so I don't know if that makes a  differnce or not. I want to be able to snap snap snap pictures but haven't been able to find the right setting for that yet. It just takes too long. I really want to love this camera and think I just need to learn how to do that and I will be happy. Can anyone help me?

Reviews.Title: More bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: thekingofB
Reviews.Content: We had a S5000 version that was a 10X zoom and 6 meg pix.  I paid less for this new S1800.  The 18X requires a tripod with full zoom but the optics seem to be excellent.  There was a little learning curve because of the differences in the two cameras.  This is a great camera for the beginner or basic user.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm FinePix S1800
Reviews.Author: KEB
Reviews.Content: This amazing camera allows me to use it as an SLR with the electronic view finder. I have had it for a month now and everything about it rates an A+. It has so many useful features. I find the battery run time to be very good using Rayovac AA HiMH-Platinum batteries. From Super Macro to 18X optical, the Dual Image Stabilization really works. I would recommend this to anyone. The on line instruction manual must be read and applied first before one calls the camera a battery consuming piece of junk.

Reviews.Title: Best deal for the money!!!!
Reviews.Author: Andriy Melnychenko "Andry"
Reviews.Content: I've always been a Cannon fan and I had my concerns about Fuji film until I bought Fuji film S1800,quality of pictures are awesome,and I couldn't  believe how many features it has.I paid 180$ for camera 4GB memory card and a fancy case,trust me you won't get a better deal.Go with Fuji film.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for a Great Price!
Reviews.Author: John F.D. Taff "John"
Reviews.Content: I searched around a lot before I committed to this camera.  Amazon has a great price for this, which is kind of like a cross between an SLR and a digital camera.  Great set of features, nice big screen on the back, pop up flash, lots of settings, even takes sound and video.  Comes with a strap, lens cap and connecting wires, plus software for the camera.  Took it out on the night I got it and took some great shots.  Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: HAPPY
Reviews.Author: Cowboy
Reviews.Content: Fujifilm FinePix S1800 12.2 MP Digital Camera with 18x Wide Angle Optical Dual Image Stabilized Zoom and 3-Inch LCDFor the price this camera is a good value !

Reviews.Title: Completely well worth the price, terrific camera
Reviews.Author: sphillay
Reviews.Content: This is camera is the best camera for taking pictures. It's very easy to use and is not heavy at all. It's perfect for taking all kinds of pictures. And for the price, you can't beat it, I definitely recommend this camera to any and everyone. Greatcamera! I'm very happy and pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Execllent relation relation between price and performance
Reviews.Author: Jaime Serrada "Jimy"
Reviews.Content: This camera has features only found on more expensive premium models. It is an excellent choice for a person who entered the world of photography.

Reviews.Title: Great Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Jorge A. Esteban
Reviews.Content: The Fujifilm S1800 is a great digital camera for a new amateur photographer.  Is easy to use and its menu features are friendly easy. Great for outdoors and in home pics. With the 12.1 mp pics your can develop really big pictures. Fun to use for my kids and grandma too.

Reviews.Title: Good Choice
Reviews.Author: rara79
Reviews.Content: Very easy to use. Just open the box and go, for the point and shoot options. I haven't tried anything fancy with it yet, but I am very pleased with the quality of the pictures I am getting and love the 18x zoom.

Reviews.Title: This is an outstanding camera.
Reviews.Author: Joshua De Leon
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great photos and the 18x zoom is amazing.  The only drawback is that the camera requires four AA batteries and it goes through them rather quickly(which is why I deducted a star); the lens cap tends to pop off a little too easily as well.  In my opinion, the zoom, picture quality and price far outweigh the only two flaws I found.  This is a great deal on a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Good quality Camera for a great price!
Reviews.Author: CN
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for someone who wants a good quality camera without having to spend a lot of money. The picture quality is very good. There are many settings to choose from for the type of environment you're in like snow, sunset, party, etc. I bought this mainly for concerts because I go to several a year and don't always get good seats so the 18x zoom is very convenient for taking close up pictures of the band onstage. It's big enough to take crisp, clear pictures but small enough that most concert arenas will allow inside their arena. The panoramic feature is fun to play with too.

Reviews.Title: Good buy for the money
Reviews.Author: Moon Roc
Reviews.Content: I bought this Camera to take shots of my youngest daughter during her cheerleading comp. It took some good still shot's; however it didn't work to well for moving shots. This camera on the other hand takes awesome shots around the house and at party's and of my new Grandson and stuff. I think that I made need to study the manual a little more to correct the action shots. Over all this is really good camera for the money. Make sure that you take time and read the manual.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: AW
Reviews.Content: I have been looking for a digital camera for over a year..I have been hesitant to switch over from film because of the cost, quality of pics, zoom, size of camera's and the speed of the cameras..I saw this camera one night really late and debated for about an hour before I bought it..  I couldnt wait for it to arrive..When it did I started taking pictures right away, good ones..Then I read the booklet and someone showed me alot more that I could do with it..  I have been having so much fun with it and its so easy to use, takes great pictures, its fast and has some heft to the camera..Its not one of those little tiny slim cameras that you feel like Your going to break if You pick it up..  I Love This Camera, well worth the price..Saw it at costco on sale 2 weeks later for 40$ more same exact thing..

Reviews.Title: Satisfied customer with a happy ending
Reviews.Author: Happy
Reviews.Content: I have no promblem with this camera.  It works great.  Just point shoot in the right setting which will automatically do everything for you.....  it even tells you when someone has closed the eyes in the picture and adjust.  Loving it!

Reviews.Title: great value, quality images
Reviews.Author: Cincinnati Slim "Cincinnati Slim"
Reviews.Content: Very good quality images, full feature set, well designed controls but could use a better printed user's guide

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Maliestra
Reviews.Content: This camera is an amazing deal!  I would recommend this camera to anyone.  It has a great large screen for viewing what you are taking a picture of, and the clarity and color are on target.  I have used the video function as well, and am very happy with what I got.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: simonjaap
Reviews.Content: With this camera I've got exactly what I wanted. Being a student I don't have much money to spend but I still wanted a camera that has a large range of custumizable settings and would create good quality photos. This camera has it all and more.The only downside I have found is the lack of RAW-photo format, but that would be too much to ask for this price and as a amateur I can work around that for now.I would suggest it to everyone looking for a easy to use camera that makes great quality pictures but still has a range of custumizable settings.

Reviews.Title: Crystal
Reviews.Author: Crystal M. Moore
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera, however a lot of the time my pictures come out fuzzy when the object (my 2 year old) is moving, it's very possible I just need to play around with the camera and get to know the features better.  If anyone wants to give me some tips, it would be greatly appreciated!  Other than that, I love this camera, great quality at a great price!

Reviews.Title: Fuji Fine Pix 1800
Reviews.Author: Jeanette Kappe
Reviews.Content: I think the camera is wonderful for a P&S; it has many features and the price was right. the only issues I have with the camera are the lens cap slips off very easily and the battery open is alittle flimsy I hope it will hold up with extreme use of changing the batteries and taking out the camera disk,

Reviews.Title: Still Learning
Reviews.Author: luvmygirls
Reviews.Content: This is the first digital camera I have owned that has been a challenge for me to use. I think it has so many features that I am having a difficult time learning how to use the camera correctly. I bought it mostly for capturing my daughter playing softball. I used it for the first time in sport mode, and many of my photos were pink. I am sure there is something I am doing wrong.I am sure that I will understand this camera some time, but I believe that it is going to take some practice and study to learn how wonderful this camera is.

Reviews.Title: Amazing quality and versitility for the price!!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: No complaints at all. I was pleased and surprized by the quality and versatility.  As an owner of the S9000 -- and still plesed with it and the ease of its video zoom--I ordered this camera just to see how good it could be for the price.  I was prepared to return it immediately after confirming my conviction that it was too good to be true.  I ended up keeping the camera and giving it as a gift to an enthusiastic amateur who had used and coveted the S9000. This one is smaller and lighter and makes a perfect bridge to the more advanced DSLR.  The quality of still images and video is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Love the FujiFilm Finepix S1800!
Reviews.Author: I'm a Balehead
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! Sometimes, very rarely it won't focus perfectly, but it just takes a couple seconds to adjust it. The 18X zoom is AWESOME! If you are using rechargeable batteries, then they literally last FOREVER! This camera can use SDHD memory cards along with just SD cards, so that's a bonus. :) It has tons of different settings and video quality is good. I would totally recommend this camera to everyone!

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: VMitchell
Reviews.Content: I had a standard cheaper digital camera for a long time when I decided I needed an upgrade but I didn't want to spend too too much. This camera really worked awesome better then what I expected. The settings are easy to find and use the pictures come out great. The only thing I wasn't use to was the batteries it takes 4 AA batteries my old digital camera (Kodak) didn't use batteries instead you had to use a wall charger or the computer. The batteries lasted a good amount of time. If you're not a professional photographer but want great pictures for a really reasonable price this is for you! I love this camera!

Reviews.Title: This camera is stupid good.
Reviews.Author: Stuart R. Donald "Stuart Reb Donald"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  The pictures are so good and it is so easy to use that it makes me wonder why other cameras aren't this good.  My neighbor is a big time tech guy and he can't believe how good the pictures look on this camera.  As good as his wife's $1400 Canon SLR without the changing lens thing.The only thing is that the zoom is loud enough to be heard on video.  Other than that this camera is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Great camera overall
Reviews.Author: Roger G. "Roger"
Reviews.Content: When you are looking for a camera that provides great level of performance and good optical zoom/megapixels ratio vs. price, this is an option for sure. This camera has several features that make its usage a good experience. I am really pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: Good for amateurs but limited for more advanced shooters.
Reviews.Author: John W. Humphrey
Reviews.Content: If I had paid more attention to the technical details, and some of the comments in other reviews I probably would not have made this purchase (I have since returned it to the supplier, with a monetary penalty, of course). As a purely point and shoot, it is probably as good or better than the comparables in this price range. However, I found poor quality in low light situations, rapid battery discharge, and the limitation in the manual settings (such as the aperture) to be very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: FUJEFILM REVIEW
Reviews.Author: SAV48432
Reviews.Content: WE LOVE THE CAMERA.  IT IS EASY TO USE, AND TAKES GREAT PICTURES.  I  DID ORDER A FUJIFILM CARD BECAUSE I HAD READ THAT THE CAMERA DIDN'T READ ALL CARDS EASILY. WE USE IT A LOT FOR LONG DISTANCE WILDLIFE SHOTS, AND THEY HAVE TURNED OUT BETTER THAN WE EXPECTED..  I WOULD RECOMMEND THIS CAMERA TO ANYONE.  FOR THE PRICE I COULDN'T FIND A BETTER BUY.

Reviews.Title: Almost Perfect
Reviews.Content: Everything is perfect for someone who is just learning to adjust aperture, ISO and shutter speed. You can just be in auto and the pics are good (taking normal photos under good conditions). The only drawback is that the view finder is quite small and so you can only use it about 4 minutes, after that your eyes may start tearing! Great for the price!!

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm FinePix S1800 12.2 MP Digital Camera with 18x Wide Angle Optical Dual Image Stabilized Zoom and 3-Inch LCD
Reviews.Author: YOU
Reviews.Content: I bought this unit on September 13, 2010. I like it a lots because it comes with 18x zoom that make something easy to picture from the far distance. It gives a nice picture when you take picture at night. It is easy to use but there is no self-timer button. It needs to set through the menu. It feature made easy to one hand when you take picture. I modified the neck strap to hand strap (like the slim camera) make it easier for one hand picture taking.

Reviews.Title: Fuji camera
Reviews.Author: N. Moore
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is excellent.  Zoom works great, anti jitter works like a charm.Software needed to be updated before processing photos on PC, but this was simple to do, then everything worked great.  I am still learning al of the features, but so far this camera has been great.

Reviews.Title: Great camera with great features and awesome pictures!
Reviews.Author: Jorge Coria
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a trip my wife and I made to Disney World in Orlando and it did not let me down one bit. This camera is very easy to use and if you have the time and patience to play around with the settings you WILL get the best picture possible every time. The videos it takes are also a very nice addition, but of course it's strong point is the awesome pictures it shells out. It was worth every penny and I would definitely recommend it to everyone I know.

Reviews.Title: Average to Good just dont expect to much from the video function
Reviews.Author: Mayvin "Reviewer"
Reviews.Content: My previous Camera was the Panasonic Lumix FZ5 12x camera so I have what to compare with.Likes:Picture quality is pretty good both indoors (with flash) and outdoors.Long zoom.Uses AA BatteryAll the manual modes.Dislikes:Price is greatNo battery meter.Video is pretty bad (grainy indoors in fully lit room)and outdoors is nothing special. My Samsung Captivate Phone takes much better video both indoors and outdoors.

Reviews.Title: Fuji flim digital camera
Reviews.Author: Dennis Earl Arnuco "marines"
Reviews.Content: Fujifilm FinePix S1800 12.2 MP Digital Camera with 18x Wide Angle Optical Dual Image Stabilized Zoom and 3-Inch LCD This is a great camera I use it on daughter Ball room competition and it perfect. I could take video at the same time by switching mode back and port.

Reviews.Title: Great great.....and the greatest camera fir this price range
Reviews.Author: Mohamed A. Saleh "Mohamed Saleh"
Reviews.Content: This is a good camera if you want to do some creative works. Taking into consideration, the price , specifications, design etc. I have done some basic research on similar cameras of different brands and found this one the best in overall aspects. It has both auto and manual functions and the view-finder which you won't find in others usually . My only issue with it is that when you take videos, you can hear the camera zooming in if you zoom in. It is not much of an issue. And after all its a camera not really a true video recorder. I give it 5 stars in everything!

Reviews.Title: Best camera ever!!
Reviews.Author: mike g.
Reviews.Content: I bought the Fuji S1800 as an upgrade from a previousFuji Fine Pix digital that my son uses now. All the features are just what I wanted and more. Great zoom and muti shot clearity. You'll need a real steady hand for zoom at the farthest level but that's to be expected because it really pulls in the target area. Great price and value you won't find at any retail store..I know cause I work at one!

Reviews.Title: a good value
Reviews.Author: john
Reviews.Content: I have only shot a few dozen shots with this camera.  I have found digital cameras so lacking compared to film that I am a late convert.  I find that once used to the controls, it is easy to use.  The zoom covers most all of my needs, and the lens, while not up to the standards of old minolta glass, has FAR less barrel and pincushion distortion than some of the earlier cannon autofocus lenses, and in fact is surprisingly good.  I particularly like the manual modes.  Image stabilization on stage one still requires a steady hand or tripod at max zoom.  Complaints about blurry zoom are user error issues.  I have not had time to check out all the "scene" modes, but being used to manual settings, this will take some getting used to.  Exposure has been dead on very consistantly.  Focus in spot mode is really "spot", so it needs close attention.  The intelligent focus mode is excellent  Macro is very clean.  In sharp mode, sharpness is on par with more expensive cameras.  Noise is  adequate at low iso settings, but despite some reviews, is better than many costlier cameras provided you stay below 800.  If you are comfortable with gimp or photoshop this is very fixable.  Noise is poor at very high iso settings.  Auto white balance, when compared to manually set balance is right on the money.  Chromatic aberation is about the same as most cameras 100- 150 $ more, a little less sharp edged and intense but sl larger.  Since there are few ultra-zoom cameras in this price range, most comparisons are with more expensive cameras.  This one will do a better job than a Nikon, not quit as good as a cannon, and is an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm all the way
Reviews.Author: M. Boxer "SSGMIke.Ivy"
Reviews.Content: all I can say is for the money a better camera is not around. Been using Fujifilm products for years and have always been satisfied with their products and quality. Way more features then I expected especially the movie making part..so easy. 5 stars

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera
Reviews.Author: Solarx.110mb
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th Fujifilm camera and all work good.  I also have a Casio S12 that I love.  This S1800 takes nice clean pictures, very little noise.  Portraits are tack sharp, landscapes are bit soft but little or no noise.  I like the image stabilization.  I set the camera to P and set my ISO to 200 indoors and I.S. still works and the ISO remains at 200.  The 18x zoom is like having a telescope.  I swear you could use this camera as a papparazi camera.  When you fully zoomed out to 18x, there is another button you can push that doubles the zoom twice.  I think that is 72x, I could be wrong but it seems like it doubles for each click.  It lowers the megapixels but the photo is still optical and sharp.  Then there is digital zoom on top of that, but I do not use it since it is apparent that it degrads the quality too much.  To get this zoom in a slr you would have to spend thousands just on the lens alone.  This camera is a very good value.The flash seems decent, good enough.I was having card errors at first until I changed the SD card.  I am using a Kingston 32GB SDHC card and it seems to be working good.  So I suggest playing with it before you start taking the important shots to make sure the card and camera like each other.The HD video is the best I have had in a camera.  The I.S. works in video also and the video turns out smoother.  It is also very clear and vibrant.  People complain about the zoom noise while taking a video.  I do not see it as a problem, especially if your video has any kind of sound, you will never hear the zoom noise.  If it is perfectly quiet, then you hear it.  There is also some background noise in video's but again, not a big deal especially if there is any kind of sound in the video.  I got a lens adapter that tightens onto the barrel of the lens.  So even though there is no thread on the lens, you can still attach things to it.  The lens adapter with a uv filter was 25.00.  I keep the uv filter off because I feel it degrads the quality, but I keep the lens tube on, it makes the camera look nicer, plus protects it from a fall.The price is right, the camera is best in it's class.

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality
Reviews.Author: Karen Zygnerski
Reviews.Content: The quality of the pictures for the price is fantastic.  It's easy on the batteries, and easy to use in that when you turn the wheel to change the setting the display shows which setting you're on at each turn.  I haven't fully learned all the features but so far I'm very happy with this camera.  There is an issue of noise during movies if you zoom in or out.  I had read that before purchasing so it wasn't a surprise and the movies are just for family enjoyment so it's not a problem for me.  I am, however, always amazed and pleased at the sharpness of the photos.  I purchased a 4 GB memory card with it and just downloaded over 300 pictures.  I'm very pleased with my purchase.  Be aware, though, that it's a fairly large camera compared to others so that might be an issue for some who like to always have a camera with them.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera
Reviews.Author: Juancho
Reviews.Content: The Fujifilm Finepix S1800 replaced my previous pocket camera. With a pocket camera you do not learn photography. But the fuji is like my first camera (a Canon SLR) and I'm learning photography again. This camera has the features of a professional camera. In P mode(program), the camera takes good pictures. But if you adjust the ISO and exposure properly, in P or M modes, you get great pictures. With a SDHC memory card Class 4, the camera offers a very good acquisition speed. However, I recommend to cancel the preview of pictures to increase the speed of response. The software is not very attractive and my computer has problems recognizing the camera.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Michael R. Blier
Reviews.Content: I am using this camera for a Digital Photography class and needed a camera with decent bang for little bucksafter looking over a bunch of different cameras this one had the advance features that I needed. It also had a very good price. Overall this purchase has been great

Reviews.Title: Great shoot for non-profi
Reviews.Author: Sergey
