Reviews.Content: I like it from the first shot. It also has a great zooming so I can make a shot with out going closer.

Reviews.Title: In love of this camera!
Reviews.Author: Luis Sebastian Pire Boada
Reviews.Content: I`m gonna be simple here, this is an extremely good option for those who are looking Good, Great and Cheap camera! Not spending so much money as a nikon or a canon cost (hey, those cameras are great too) but here you are paying half of their price and you are receiving absolute great quality! I couldn`t be happier than now with my Fujifilm S1800! It`s light, if you use it with Energizer Ultimate Lithium AA batteries plus 8Gb memory stick, you`ll have enough fun during your trips!

Reviews.Title: Gets the job done
Reviews.Author: x-man
Reviews.Content: this camera is awesome for anybody that wants to practice being a professional photographer because its very basic. Overall though its fun to use and it's very light weight. I really enjoy the panoramic feature and I really have a lot of fun with the HD video recorder. Down side is your really just paying for the extra zoom and that is it, because you can find some really compact camera that fit in your pocket for the same price and all the same features except the zoom of course. But its not a bad camera I don't regret buying one.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic, versatile camera!
Reviews.Author: emilark
Reviews.Content: What a great camera! I borrowed a friend's similar Fuji camera last year when I was going on a trip and loved it's ease of use and quality pictures. I just bought this one, and it is exceptional! A great camera at a great price. It arrived the next day, as well. Pretty amazing overall, I have no complaints!

Reviews.Title: Awsome, Solid Camera.
Reviews.Author: Dan W. Crosby
Reviews.Content: Awsome, Solid Camera. I would recommend this camera to anyone hesitating on purchase of expensive SLR. You wont be sorry.

Reviews.Title: Give it a try!
Reviews.Author: R. Quackenbush "spa seeker"
Reviews.Content: For those of you who don't need all the bells and whistles on a camera, this might be for you. I am still learning all the settings, but for the most part for a 12 mp , it seems to do just fine. The zoom impressed me the most as it magnification and clarity was a great surprise. I tried out indoor shots as well as outdoor shots. The flash is a bit lame and the pictures turned out a tad dark but I can lighten them with my photo editing software. With outdoor shots I was impressed with the sharpness. The software that comes with it is not very good, so I am just going to use my own. For the price, you should give it a try.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the PRICE
Reviews.Author: Chris Milam
Reviews.Content: I had one o the Fuji Finepix and recommended it to a fried to purchase. Its a better camera then the one I bought and easy or "Dog and Cat" easy as my frind says. Great zoom and good shipping.

Reviews.Title: new camera
Reviews.Author: Tom Weiner
Reviews.Content: I find that Fuji cameras in general are well made and are user friendly but also produce very high quality photo work.

Reviews.Title: Better than a "point and shoot",almost a DSLR
Reviews.Author: Ronald C Fung
Reviews.Content: The price of the camera is great for all that you get with it.  I have just return from a trip to the Grand Canyon, and the pictures are awesome!! The panorama mode is terrific but it takes some learning to use. The 18X optical zoom works smooth, stable and quick, was able to take great shots of a condor over the canyon. I was able to frame my shots in bright sunlight with the in-camera view finder and not with the 3" LCD A great advantage over my old "point and shoot" You have control of the manual settings as well as a auto mode. This is a great camera if you want to step up from a "point and shoot" but can not afford the DSLR. It will not fit in your pocket and the manual is skimpy on instruction.

Reviews.Title: Balanced Bargain
Reviews.Author: Jason M. Freeman
Reviews.Content: A model which bridges the gap, so to speak. Combining form and function of a d-slr w/ the ease of use of a point and shoot model for a very fair price. Probably not for a picky photographer, but perfect for beginners likes me, and likely to be handy for the more knowledgeable shutterbug as a back-up, or even recreational model. It loses a star on account of the finepix software that comes with it being something of a pain. Other than that, a recommended purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: L. Grant
Reviews.Content: I purchased this particular camera due to the reviews I read here.This is a terrific camera and I could not be more pleased with the quality of the pictures. The zoom is fantastic and I have gotten some beautiful pics of the wildlife on my lake including herons, kingfishers and beavers. Flower pictures offer incredible detail with this camera. I had NO idea that a camera in this price range would offer such detail!

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: Jeff Knight
Reviews.Content: Good camera so far.  Fast shutter speed so lots less missed / blurry pictures.  As others have mentioned, the video capture is great but the zoom's motor is loud.My wife likes it and she hates techy things and managed to pick this up pretty quickly.

Reviews.Title: Good choice for the money
Reviews.Author: RJQ2001
Reviews.Content: My husband loves this camera. He has always been into taking quality pictures, and we have owned and used an old Fuji SLR film camera for years. My daughter gave us her old Fujifilm A303 digital, which was so user friendly, that when it finally quit working well, we went straight back to Fujifilm and bought the Finepix S1800. It is not for the fainthearted; let me make that clear here! My husband loves it, but he read the book-the one you download and is over an inch thick, rather than the owners manual that comes with it. He can make that camera do everything you would ever want. It doesn't have manual control for closing down the lens, which is the only place he would want improved, but this is really more of a professional type of users camera.I just take pictures in the auto mode. And, they don't come out like the ones he takes using all the bells and whistles it has. I do, however, get some fairly good pix, just not always. If you don't mind taking the time to learn how to use this camera, it is very worth it. It is as good, using the manual mode, as a camera priced at over twice the amount we paid for this one. I will get around to learning more and more about this camera, but, it is NOT intuitive to use the way my old A303 is.

Reviews.Title: Hordes of feautres, REASONS FOR PRICE!!!
Reviews.Author: Guillermo Perez
Reviews.Content: For the price you can;t get more camera than this.I got it for my wife, who after me getting both a Nikon D60 and now a Canon T2i, plus 3 lenses, got sort of mad that she stillhad a canon digital elph 6 megapixel point and shoot... and I certainly would'nt want her going around with my gear!!!... so I did my best for getting her a very decent and capable camera that would not be hard to use.This camera delivers... however too many features at such a price had me suspicious as most people probably would be.Here's the thing IT DOES HAVE A EVF (electronic viewfinder) which is super cool for a point and shoot, but the image on it is INSANELY bad, HOWEVER it is a great feature for those of us familiar with POINTING from the eye, not in front of your body.... of ourse it has a huge 3 inch display, very handy... menus are easy and image quality is pretty decent.The zoom is a monster... albeit it DOES make the lens slower... which for night shots will be notieable... but it does have a pretty efficient ISO range... night shots without flash can be done pretty well... specially with the presets.THE DRAWBACKS ARE IT ONLY USES AA BATTERIES which for such a feature filled camera makes you wonder WHY THE HELL did they NOT use Lithium, like small canon and nikon cameras do... and also writing speed is SLOWER than I expected.those are the major issues... everything else is tip top... build materials are actually very very good... it feels as solid in m hand as my DSLR does.Someone looking for good daylight photos... good picture sizes and a bargain buy, will be satisfied.on low light this camera plain sucks.

Reviews.Title: S1800
Reviews.Author: R. Frommell
Reviews.Content: We took this camera on vacation with us to Jamaica. During this trip (our 25th anniversary) we had our 15 year old daughter taking pictures as we renewed our wedding vows. The camera worked flawlessly! she took some amazing pictures.

Reviews.Title: Nice Upgrade
Reviews.Author: H. Muller "Retired"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera to replace our very old Olympus C-740.  Wanted to stay with Olympus but their offering did not have a ELF which is important to us.  Shipping was very efficient, price also a consideration.  We have not used this camera extensively yet but right out of the box the controls are intutive, we took many test shots to get familiar, some of which were blurred because we did not understand the shutter mechanism.  We took it to a graduation and it performed very nice, not too much telephoto work.Camera fits in the hand with controls where one might expect them to be.  The cable that connects to the computer USB port seems to be far too delicate for multiple uses so to completely avoid this we purchased a reader for the chip.  This way we can remove the chip, insert it into the reader, plug the reader into the USB and upload or edit the photos.We do need to read the manual since we want to set the shut down timer for a longer duration.Nice product, look forward to using it on our Europe trip this fall.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera Packed with Features
Reviews.Author: TRFB
Reviews.Content: I am an amatuer photographer.  This is my second camera I own.  I own the Sony Cybershot DSC-P5 which was a great camera back in the days.  But the FujiFilm S1800 is far beyond the Sony Cybershot.  This camera is a 12 Megapixel camera capable of shooting panorama pictures right from the camera.  There are a lot of features besides this.  I'm not a fan of Optical Zoom, but this camera handles it well.  There are many custom settings based on the situation.  Scenic, Portrait, Nightime, Sports.  It also allows you to shoot continues frames as well.  There are a few different options within the continuous frame mode itself.It also shoots 640p movies.  Depending on the amount of SDHC memory you can shoot up to 30 minutes worth of video. At the largest files and resolution.The camera has a great feature for face recognition and also blink detection.  Which alerts you when the camera thinks that the person blinked.  You have the option to re-shoot.I like the fact that you can do a panormaic shot up to three panels and the camera will "stitch" the picture for you right from the camera.  Many other cameras rely on you to do this with the software, but you can do it right from the camera.The best thing is that this camera runs on regular AA alkaline batteries, or other types that size and not these batteries that are hard to find or need to be recharged.  You can use AA rechargeable batteries, but if not, the good old AA Alkaline will work.  My mother has a camera that she can't find batteries for because they no longer make them.  I'm so happy that this camera is not like that.The things that I thought would've been nice is a better lens cap.  It comes off very easily.  The other thing I wish it would do is automatically pop the "Flash" hood up for you if the lighting is not enough and the mode is set where you need light.  One of the Canon pictures I use at work, actually opens the hood for the flash when it detects that there needs a flash.  With the Fuji S1800 you need to press the button to open the hood.The other issue I have is that I wish it would include at least a 2 MB SD memory card.  You're very limited with the amout of pictures you can take with the Internal memory.The software was easy to install and you can download the pictures/videos right to your computer and edit them with your favorite software.This is a pretty good camera and I'm pretty satisified with.

Reviews.Title: I returned it
Reviews.Author: Rocky Top "Rocky"
Reviews.Content: Nice little camera and it does take nice pictures, but it had a few annoyances that caused me to take it back.The good.1.  Uses AA batteries which you can get anywhere.  Also works fine with rechargeable AA batteries.2.  Uses standard SD card which is nice for moving pictures around.The annoyances.1.  Uses a proprietary cable.  I don't want to have to keep track of and carry this specific single-use cable.  If a device does not use one of the standard mini- or micro-USB cables, I cannot be bothered.2.  As other users have pointed out, the cover for the cable jack up seems like it's not going to last more than a few weeks.3.  I don't like having to open the battery cover to get out my SD card.  If I leave the cover open too long, the camera loses the day/date setting.4.  The battery cover does not seem very robust.5.  The camera will not work with my Eye-Fi SD card.  If you have used one of these cards, you know how super convenient it is for transferring pictures to the PC.  If the camera worked with my Eye-Fi card, the cable, the jack covering, and the SD card being under the battery cover really wouldn't bother me enough to return the camera.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Camera
Reviews.Author: C.Noel
Reviews.Content: This camera stopped working within the week I had it. It's almost like it's bipolar. At times it will work fine, and others it will just freeze up and top working after taking about 16 pictures.DO NOT BUY. It's such horrible quality.

Reviews.Title: Good while it lasted....
Reviews.Author: acamp
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera December 2010 and it just stopped working this month (Nov 2011). Picture quality was great but now I have to buy a new camera or try to get it repaired. Very disappointing, there was no reason for the camera to stop working, no damage. Obviously will not buy again because call me crazy, but I feel a camera should last longer than 11 months.

Reviews.Title: Horrible! Takes Grainy, Noisy, Dark Low Quality Photos
Reviews.Author: D. Kane
Reviews.Content: I am by no means a professional photographer, but I like to take high quality photos. For the past several years I have exclusively owned Panasonic Lumix FZ series cameras and have loved them. I like DSLR type cameras because they are more sturdy and have more features than point and shoot cameras. My most recent camera was a Panasonic FZ35 that I paid $329 for. By accident I dropped it and it broke. It was still under warranty, but I was told it could take weeks or months to get it repaired by Panasonic's repair company.In the meantime I needed a camera because I am a seller on ebay and I have to take photos of my products. I was in a pinch and borrowed my mom's Canon PowerShot A470. It was a horrible camera! The photos came out blurry, the exposure was way off and my pictures looked dreadful. The only way I could take a decent photo with that camera was if I had a tripod and the photo was taken outdoors. I was desperate for a cheap camera that would take quality photos.With both fingers crossed behind my back, I purchased the Fuji S1800. I saw a few negative reviews stating that the photo quality was lacking. I don't know why, but I chose to ignore them.I was looking for more than just a point and shoot camera and one that was similar to my favorite Panasonic Lumix DSLR type cameras. As soon as I received this one I took it out of the box and fired it up. It was a nice looking camera and was almost identical in looks to my favorite Lumix FZ series DSLR type cameras. The body felt somewhat cheap and plasticky though. I was nervous because I hoped I didn't just waste my money. The pictures came out blurry, dark, grainy and the colors were soft and not vivid.It does have a lot of features similar to the Panasonic Lumiz FZ35, but the quality of the camera is just not up to par with my Panasonic. I know the camera is a lot less expensive than the Panasonic camera I am mentioning, but for the price it should at least take considerably better pictures. I tweaked all the different features, tried all the different menu features and it still did not really make much of a difference. What a shame because I really wanted to like this camera.Also what surprised me is that even the worst cameras will take a decent photo outside. This one was horrible outside and everything came out very dark. I tried adjusting the white balance and the iso settings and it still didn't do much. I also even tried using the flash outdoors in shady areas and everything still had a dark hue.Only in the best lighting conditions will this camera perform well. I must be naive because I thought Fuji made high quality cameras.I am very disappointed to say the least and will never purchase another Fuji camera again.

Reviews.Title: Very poor camera!
Reviews.Author: anne jones
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera thinking it might be a step up from my Canon Sureshot, which I have had about five years. I liked the idea of the zoom lens. The first night I used it, at our family Christmas party, the camera failed.After taking one picture, it would freeze up.I had to remove the batteries, replace, and then shoot another picture. WHile the quality of the pictures was good, the camera is clearly cheap and faulty. I should have known better. Don't buy it.Amazon tho, did return my full purchase price with no hassle.Also, I did not receive a CD with the camera that had the owners manual on it.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Mom of Two
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to see the UPS truck coming down my street with my new camera on board!  Little did I know how disappointed I would soon be.  Removed camera from the box, installed batteries and new SD card, took a few practice shots to get a feel for it and explore the settings and functionality.  Within about 15 minutes and maybe 10 photos later I got an error message that said..."Turn camera off then back on".  So...I tried that...multiple times with no success.  Same message over and over.  I took out the batteries, SD card and waited awhile then replaced batteries and SD card hoping this would fix the problem...NOPE.  I even called the phone # to Fuji to see if someone could help me troubleshoot...NOPE.  The only help/reply I got from the Fuji rep was..."Send it back".  Obviously, very disappointed that my camera was evidently defective.  I have never bought a Fuji product and NEVER will again.

Reviews.Title: Una excelente compra!
Reviews.Author: Rod
Reviews.Content: Hasta el momento no puedo estar más contento con mi compra. Desde la facilidad para comprar, la precisión de la fecha de envio, y el producto han sido simplemente geniales. La camara es facil de usar, las fotos estan claras y con buenos colores, y los videos, sobre todo en calidad HD están buenisimos. Lo malo es que a pesar de usar una gran tarjeta SD solo se pueden grabar videos de hasta 9 min y medio en calidad HD y 12 min app. en 640.

Reviews.Title: Intellig flash is a pai
Reviews.Author: Alexis M. Meizoso
Reviews.Content: The camera is as good as I expected, but to use the flash you must open it. And the batteries that came with it died within the first six shots

Reviews.Title: This Camera Has it All
Reviews.Author: Steven James
Reviews.Content: After many years of resistance I finally moved into the 21st Century and got a digital camera. Yippee!! No more rolls of film to develop or negatives to deal with. I should have done this years ago.  I absolutely LOVE my new Fujifilm FinePix camera. I have just begun experimenting with all the many features this fine little camera offer...including stability and red-eye reduction functions.  The pictures have been ultra clear in all environments. I have used it in sunny weather at the beach as well as inside with a flash for evening parties. I'm not able to give a technical review since I don't know enough about digital cameras yet. However as a dilettante I have found this lightweight, easy to handle camera a valuable asset. I can't wait until this summer comes when I go on a vacation and really get to see how it handles. Until then I will use it for fun and work activities as I master my digital skills. I think this is an awesome camera for a good price.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Vacanti "design girl"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera about one month ago. I have already used this camera to photograph food products for a job. It's an awesome camera. There are many settings to explore on this camera. It even has a few auto settings that work well and adapt to the setting you are in. It's a great camera in all environments, even in low lighting it seems to still take good pictures. My last Fujifilm camera only had 7 MP and I compared them both. Having a 12MP camera really makes a huge difference. The image is much more clear and there is no fuzziness.This camera also has a focus feature, it detects faces and red-eye. I would recommend getting a tripod and rechargeable batteries for this camera. I would not recommend this camera if you want a small camera just to take around. If you are more into photography or want a camera to take on the job, this is the camera for you. I still have much to explore with this camera!

Reviews.Title: Loved my Finepix s5200, HATED the s1800!
Reviews.Author: J. R. Weide "musclecar-man"
Reviews.Content: I have owned a Fujifilm Finepix S5200 for several years.  It has been a great camera, but an accident has put a crack in the lens, leaving an annoying mark on pictures taken.  So, I started shopping online and reading reviews for a replacement.I considered several different cameras including similar models by Canon, Sony, and Kodak.  Because of the love I had for my S5200, I decided to buy the Fuji Finepix S1800.Needless to say I was VERY Disappointed!!!The primary reason for my disappointment was the picture quality in natural/low light conditions.  I tried every setting imaginable to produce a good picture inside my house.  Everything without the flash was grainy.  I took pictures with my S5200 from the same angles in the same light, just on the auto setting.  These pictures were way better!  We also attended a concert for my son and shot some video in the school's gym.  Again, very grainy, unimpressive picture.  This left me thinking that the S1800 was not an improvement over the S5200.  Also, the quality of the display was sub par, as you have probably read in other reviews.I returned the S1800 and purchased a Lumix ZS5.  No problems in low light with the Panasonic camera, so it looks like a keeper.  My love of Fuji cameras has come to a sad end.

Reviews.Title: DON'T BUY THIS CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Marcos Simas
Reviews.Content: I bought two of this cameras as Christmas gift to friends and I am very disappointed with the low quality of the product. When you use the zoom while is recording a video the camera captures the NOISE of the zoom's motor very high. One of my friends that I gave brought me back the camera and asked if I can exchange the product, saying that probably is a defect. But the other one said the same thing and a checked with my own hands! What a shame for me! What can I do now?

Reviews.Title: Best bang for your buck for advanced users
Reviews.Author: Jen "Geek Girl"
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, I love the handgrip on this camera. As a former point and shoot, I wanted to upgrade to something that was more advanced but also easier to use. The handgrip is really great for keeping my hands steady for zoomed shots. Being used to point and shoot and taking photos with my iPhone, I instantly noticed a difference in zoomed picture quality. Still, as others have mentioned, you will probably need a tripod for extreme zoom which is to be expected from any camera.The 18x wide-angle optical zoom is AWESOME! I have never had a camera like this before and, like I said, been an iPhoneographer primarily and rarely get prints of photos, only upload them for friends and family to view on Picasa and Facebook. Anyway, the wide-angle lens is amazing. I live in the land of 10,000 lakes and there are opportunities all around me to capture gorgeous landscapes from lakes to hillsides to beautiful green forests. This was the big hook for me. I'm a panorama addict and I can't rave enough about how great these pictures are. I'm also looking forward to my next family reunion and getting everyone in one shot without having to squish everyone together. The zoom has also won me over completely. It is extremely powerful. The example images are no exaggeration. I zoomed in on my neighbors mailbox halfway down the street and could clearly see the intricate detail and name carved out of the post. I could have never done this with my point and shoot.The Sensor-shift Image Stabilization is also very valuable to me. We were out adventuring last week and it was a brisk, chill day and I had the darnedest time keeping my hands still with that chilly wind beating on me. But every picture I took was still clear as day and you'd never know how I was struggling to keep still.About the HD video capture, however, I have to be honest and say it's not that great. In fair light conditions the video was pretty grainy. It wasn't terrible and my cheap video camera does much worse, but I was somewhat disappointed. The resolution was huge, sure, but the quality was just not there. It certainly wasn't any better than my current point and shoot, but not any worse either so I guess it's a wash in that respect. On the other hand, I love that we can just plug the camera right into the TV and show off our photos with a slideshow or watch the videos on the fly right after taking them. My 5-year-old loved the fact that I could set the camera up and let him dance while he watched himself on the big screen. A nice plus. ;)I also love having a viewfinder, as others have mentioned. I don't really have too much trouble seeing the LCD on sunny days, but sometimes for me it's just easier to get the shot I want with a traditional viewfinder. As for the LCD, I was disappointed at first that it is not a touchscreen, but what started as disappointment quickly turned into appreciation. My point and shoot has a touchscreen and I am constantly accidentally changing settings just by holding the camera. I really enjoy having complete control over the UI, even though it is done through the buttons and not touchscreen. Sometimes doing things the old way is better!I do have to point out a few flaws as others have, regarding the blink detection and smile recognition. These have never worked for me and seem completely random. I am looking to just turn them off because it gets rather annoying when the camera won't take the picture because it's waiting for the smile that's already present. That said, you are still getting a lot of camera for your money. This is the same price as my little point and shoot, which will still have a place in my home simply because it's so small and portable, but for special events and when I'm looking to capture something really great, this camera is my new best friend. It has so many advanced features, just enough to get me going on my journey to became a better photographer, but not too much to be overwhelming or to require me to tote along a huge bag full of gadgets. Overall, worth the purchase for sure!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Jen in PA "Jen S."
Reviews.Content: I am still learning a lot right now so this review is from a person who uses the basic point & shoot functions! I don't like not being able to pick my own setting(night, macro,etc), it is automatic on here but so far the camera has made good choices. Some of my pictures come out very sharp & others do not so I am not sure why that is. Overall the camera is definitely worth the $200 price tag. It isn't as great as I expected so far but it is a good camera. I think the more I learn about ISO & aperture the more I may like this camera. I think it is capable of taking great pics but the person behind the camera has to be more than just a beginner!

Reviews.Title: Horrible Video
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: Ok I know you buy a camera for pictures not video, pictures it take good quality pix as good as any other camera $250 or below, but the HD video is horrible I cant even believe Fuji would release something out like this, video picture is soft, grainy, washed of color, the zoom motor is loud on the recorded audio and mine had a constant high pitch whine in the recorded audio, I have a point and shot Casio EX-S12 that takes just about as good pixs and the HD video on it even at 24fps looked so much better, returned the S1800, if video not a plus for you then the camera on pics wise does look nice and packed full of options and extras, but if you need HD video like me, pass on it, for the price taking only pictures you cant beat it for a super zoom camera, its the price alone is why I originally bought it.

Reviews.Title: Kodak devotee for a reason
Reviews.Author: Araminta Self "minta"
Reviews.Content: I just bought  the FINEPIX S1800 at a Fred Meyers. I am glad they have a decent return policy. I will be returning it  as soon as I get back from my family vacation. I have owned a Kodak easy share z740 for the last 5 years. It is a 5 MP camera and it was amazing. I lost it and did not want to be without a camera for the trip. I am investing in a Nikon D5000, however, sadly,the order will not be here untill I get back. So I needed a camera quickly. I wanted a large camera as I am hard on the small ones and they are easily lost.  Because I just  lost my Kodak, and it was a decent sized camera, I wanted to take no chances with a  small one. I assuemd the Fujifilm, since it was large, bulky, and looked hardy, would take great pics. Ha! Size is  NOT everything! There are a number of things wrong with it. 1) The LCD screen is grainy, a blue, hazy, moving grainy, that is very annoying. My Kodac, even after years of abuse and use, never had a grainy screen.2) when I tried to delete pics the camera would freeze up and not complete the delete comand. It would also freeze up after I zoomed in or out. This is not winning it any admiration from me. The only way to unfreeze it was to dislodge the battery compartment and remove the batteries as the on/off switch was also froze up.3) Low light is terrible and since I will be taking a lotof indoor pics, I will treat this like a cheap disposable camera as that is what it seems to amount to.  I fully intend on returning this camera when I get back and hopefully my Kodak will show up, if not, I am buying a Kodak easy share so I will have a decent back up to my Nikon. Fuji film made okay film back in the day but I am not so sure about their digital world.

Reviews.Title: Decent, but freezes
Reviews.Author: C. Brackett "TMCMOM3"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as an upgrade from my skinny Kodak point and shoot. I have 3 kids and wanted to take nice pictures of them. After 3 weeks of pretty nice pictures, I started taking pics of my 6 yr old riding a bike with no training wheels for the first time, and it froze. Wouldn't unlock until I removed and then replaced the batteries (batteries were new) called tech support and they had me reset, which didn't help. The flash also wouldn't work and the memory card got corrupted. So, it went back. Getting a Canon Powershot SX20IS instead. From what I have seen this is not a known problem with this camera, so chances are I got a lemon, and with my luck I would have gotten another lemon, otherwise I might have bought a new fine-pix as I was happy with it until this fiasco. I just don't want to miss any more important milestones in my kids lives! My rating is more like a 2 1/2

Reviews.Title: "Wide Angle" it is not
Reviews.Author: T. Shields
Reviews.Content: A true wide angle lens needs to be less than 20 mm.  18 mm is "wide angle"  - a 28 mm lens is fine for snapshots but people who need a real wide angle like Realtors and appraisers....28 mm don't cut it.

Reviews.Title: poor
Reviews.Author: Bobbi Chandler
Reviews.Content: Can not upload pictures from camera to computer. Can not contact seller. Have tried to call and email Fuji to no avail. Will not buy again.

Reviews.Title: cool little camera
Reviews.Author: Ryan D. Wiley "M83"
Reviews.Content: Just got this camera a couple of days ago,so far have been very impressed. I am a novice in every sense of the word and this camera makes it easy to at least take a nice looking picture. Rice feature set and a great zoom. Took some early spring outdoor pictures today and am very pleased with the vibrant results! One complaint which i have seen in other reviews, lens cap is too big?! very strange flaw but I can deal with it, especially since the thing is dirt cheap. If your not a person who needs a camera that takes magazine quality photos i think you will be very please with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Quality Cam
Reviews.Author: isumath07
Reviews.Content: I rarely write reviews, but FujiFilm honestly just makes great cameras. I love this cam. It zooms, it's easy to use, it's durable. It will last. You CAN'T go wrong with FUJI. I think the style of it isn't the best, but still, a great camera. Overall, I would recommend this camera to anyone. It looks a bit outdated, but it's performance is on top.(The reviewer was compensated for posting this review. However, the opinion stated in the review is that of the reviewer and the reviewer alone. Further, the reviewer independently selected this product to review and has no affiliation with the product maker/distributor, Amazon or the review requester.)

Reviews.Title: Fujiflim s1800
Reviews.Author: Elvis Pedraza
Reviews.Content: Camara con un zoom potente de 18x, compacta, baterias 4 AA, buenas funciones para el rango de precio es que esta, posee giroscopo para visualizar las fotos correctamente

Reviews.Title: Mom Loves it!
Reviews.Author: B. Heath
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a present for my "Tech-Retarded" mother.  Within 20 min of having it out of the package she was taking stunning pictures, and videos.  Very easy to use, I'm confident a drunk monkey could take great pictures with this thing. Runs on 4 AA rechargeable batteries, can run on AC power if pluged in, short cord though.

Reviews.Title: Great outdoor, poor indoor
Reviews.Author: Julie Allen
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera hoping for better quality images than my previous point and shoot.  I'm not a professional by any means and I only shoot in the auto settings, but I take a lot of photos and I know what looks good.  They photos from this camera looked great when they're taken in natural, outdoor light.  I took the camera with my to Charleston and was able to take beautiful photos of the architecture.  The problems with this camera arose when I tried to take indoor photos.  If you can use natural light, the photos are fine.  If you are unfortunate enough to need the flash, you're going to get a terrible photo.  Every photo taken with a flash was much too bright.Even when I would back up and use the zoom feature, most of the time these photos were too bright and washed out.  As a busy mom of three children, we spend a lot of time indoors and every photo turned out terrible.  I'm getting rid of this one and buying the Cannon DSLR that I wanted in the first place!

Reviews.Title: Poor quality images
Reviews.Author: photomom
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as an alternative for my Nikon D80, granted there is NO comparison, but I was willing to compromise on some fronts for convenience and price.  Just wanted a little, affordable camera to throw in my purse that also had an eye viewfinder.  I am sending this back because the image quality was so POOR.  There was a lot of noise in every image.  I tested it out for a week and back it goes.  There are somethings I just can't settle on.  Also, the lens cap did not sit tight on the lens and always fell off.  Very cheap in construction.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Content: I was very exited to receive the Fujifilm FinePix S1800 12.2 MP. Especially for the features and the price range. The quality of the photos are great not excellent or amazing, just great. I was just very disappointed about the quality of the video even thou it said it is in HD, it doesn't look like it and it looks very poor. The other thing was the LCD screen I don't know if my camera came damage or if it is a Fujifilm FinePix S1800 style but the image always appear on my screen like it was fuzzy and raining type. So I decide to return it and I got a PANASONIC DMC-G10 instead and Oh my god the difference it's right there; the quality of the photos and videos are amazing.

Reviews.Title: short life
Reviews.Author: spendsalot
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera in fall and went to northern Wisconsin for a weekend.  The camera took beautiful pictures and it was fun to learn to use it.  I kept it in the case at home in the closet and used it a few more times just to try the different features.  About 2 months after purchase I thought it was just eating up batteries, now the thing doesn't register in memory any pics taken though they show on the screen as if they are there.  No pics in the memory.  Tried new batteries, fresh rechargables and a new memory card-nothing! Lots of money wasted on a non-returnable piece of crap that only worked for 2 months!It was great while it lasted but I sure wouldn't recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm Finepix Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Mary Essenpreis "wkndwif"
Reviews.Content: This Camera was bought to be used by a police agency. We are very happy with its performance. I would recommend this personal use as well.

Reviews.Title: Fuji s1800
Reviews.Author: Mark94
Reviews.Content: I am thinking of purchasing this camera but I am concerned about the batteries, my old Nikon camera is no match to this and has a lithium batter back. I am thinking of buying rechargeable batteries but doesn't know if that's the right choice,any help?.

Reviews.Title: Windows 7 not recognized.
Reviews.Author: Ted Robbins
Reviews.Content: I was greatly excited to receive the camera. Excited until just after installing the software on my computer and finding that I couldn't upload photos to my computer. To make a long story short, it took me a couple of hours to find out that the software package supplied with the camera was not compatible with Windows 7, and that I would have to download an entirely new package (60+MB). My reading revealed that the software package supplied was written for Windows XP. Fuji, this is not the way to impress a new customer.That problem aside, I have been quite satisfied with the overall performance of the camera. Knowing what I know now, I would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm S1800 digital camera
Reviews.Author: Annie
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Fujifilm S1800 digital camera from Amazon.com. I love it. It takes great photos and is easy to use. I am very happy that I made this purchase.

Reviews.Title: great camera, bad downloading program
Reviews.Author: Nicole A. Castellano "card maker"
Reviews.Content: I like this camera alot. The zoom is great and the features are easy to use. I realize that people complain of fuzzy pictures, but they just don't understand the partial click down. I happen to like this feature. It gives you the ability to frame the subject. I also like the video quality along with decent sound quality. My only complaint in the download program. It's terrible. Sometimes the program links to the camera and sometimes it doesn't, there is no rhyme or reason behind it. And there aren't alot of editing features. The manual gives you little to no guidance on how to troubleshoot the downloading.

Reviews.Title: confused
Reviews.Author: still looking
Reviews.Content: I've been watching this item for several weeks, reading all of the comments. I was almost ready to make a purchase & this morning the price has changed 3 times! Now I'm going to wait and see how this shakes out!!

Reviews.Title: Was great while it lasted!
Reviews.Author: picmom
Reviews.Content: This camera took great pictures on our vacation.  We came home and I put it up for a few weeks.  I got it out to take Easter Pictures and it will not work.  It lasted all of 5 weeks.  While this camera is not as expensive as some, I expected it to last more than a few weeks.

Reviews.Title: Fujifillm finepix s1800 review
Reviews.Author: Lydia K. Gosnell "Lydz"
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this camera! It takes wonderful pictures and the zoom is awesome. A whole lot of camera for the money!

Reviews.Title: Fuji fudge
Reviews.Author: Ayaz Shaikhzadeh "Ayaz Shaikhzadeh"
Reviews.Content: I give it 3 stars only because of its price otherwise it deserves 2 stars. Actually quite a disappointment, from build quality to picture quality especially in low light conditions. One would have hoped that by now with the advancement of technology a decent picture is the least one should take for granted from one of the big camera manufacturers. But sadly it is not so. All in all this camera's results are no better comparatively than a simple point and shoot. From inability to focus accurately to incorrect flash illumination are some of the woes. The body also has the look and feel of low quality plastic. Lens cover is very loose and does not stay in place. But as I said it's saving grace is its price.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera, Bad Focus
Reviews.Author: Alixe
Reviews.Content: Good camera, but focus is too bad.I can not start shooting without putting the zoom at 0x, it always runs out of focus.Another thing is that you can not move the zoom during filming without the risk of losing focus as well.The focus is terrible. Even in pictures, I have to be careful.It is worth investing more, in order to have a better camera.I have a Kodak same pattern, much better.

Reviews.Title: Technology trickle-down needs to be given a bit longer...
Reviews.Author: G. M. Arnold "Geoff, that is"
Reviews.Content: We take the "trickle-down" of technology for granted, and nowhere more so than in digital photography. A couple of years ago, most cameras had sensors that could register 3-4 megapixels and  "optical zoom" of 3x. Indeed zoom was so pitiful that camera incorporated the widely ridiculed "digital zoom" which traded image quality for zoom. Things like 10MP sensors and zooms of greater than 12x were the province of the semi-pro and DSLR crowd, and commanded commensurate prices. Today, every camera can handle more pixels than we know what to do with, and even shirt-pocket sub-compacts can do impressive optical zooms using bizarre optical plumbing.I used to have a rule: buy the best digital camera I could get for $250. Every 18 months I would get a new device which absolutely knocked the socks off its predecessor. Technology trickle down.But how fast does stuff trickle down? And what happens if a manufacturer gets it wrong?Coincidentally, I got hold of the subject of this review, the Fujifilm S1800, just a few days after I'd bought myself a Nikon Coolpix P90. On paper, they look fairly comparable. The S1800 is 12MP, with 18x zoom; the P90 is 12.1MP with 24x zoom. (But how often will I care about the difference between 18x and 24x?) Both have image stabilization (essential at high zoom, unless you carry around a tripod), and loads of fancy features which take forever to learn. The biggest difference is the price: the P90 cost me just under $400, while the S1800 is $204 - almost half the price. Clearly the S1800 is a great demonstration of technology trickle-down: features which used to be expensive are now available at a more modest price.Well, maybe not. My partner and I tried the S1800 in various settings - portraits, landscapes, action shots, bird-watching, macro - and neither of us was impressed. The autofocus light is extraordinarily bright: portrait subjects were literally dazzled by it. Action shots and birdwatching were frustrating, because the shutter lag is so bad. Landscapes? Every shot required color rebalancing. And the slow, noisy zoom discourages the use of the available 18x magnification.You can see a couple of comparative shots at my MobileMe gallery - go to [...]The S1800 certainly includes a number of interesting features, and I'd encourage you to see if any of them address your personal photography needs. It offers HD video, but frankly if I want video recording I'm going to use a dedicated camcorder like my trusty JVC Everio GZ-HM200. But at the end of the day, I felt that the FinePix S1800 wasn't ready for prime time - that the relevant technologies had not yet "trickled down" to the point where they were really usable. The worst offender is the shutter lag, which is probably symptomatic of a range of small design choices and technology selections.I'm sticking with my P90.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Traci Swoboda
Reviews.Content: This was my BIG christmas present to myself and I blame myself for such a bad choice. I am disappointed with the view screen-looks awful, as if I am looking through a very bad old tv signal from the 80's. Night time pics are the worst if I'm indoors. Not a happy camper.

Reviews.Title: battery life is too short
Reviews.Author: Mila
Reviews.Content: I have this camera two days,and I really like it,but,the camera needs 4 batteries,and they don't last even one day.Well,if camera consumes so much energy does it worst it to have it?I even did not take too many pictures today,no more than 20...

Reviews.Title: Sucks down the batteries!
Reviews.Author: Natalie
Reviews.Content: It's a ok camera for the price. But literally the thing goes through batteries like crazy. It took pictures for about an hour or so, and then the batteries were dead (4 batteries!). I took pictures for a couple hours and I went through 8 batteries! I wish I would have just spent more and gotten a Cannon. I almost don't want to use this camera because of how many batteries I go through when taking pictures.

Reviews.Title: It does what I want but it is cheaply made
Reviews.Author: BritChris
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace a Canon Elph which had only a 3x zoom.  I love the 18X zoom feature as it gives such versatility to the camera.  It is lightweight and easy to hold and manage.  The accompanying manual is short and efficient.  I have loaded the CD to be able to connect to Fuji's editing and printing program and it does not connect to the Internet.  Tried twice and failed.  Guess I will stick with [...] for editing and printing.  I dislike using 4 AA batteries but knew that would be an issue when I bought it.  My biggest complaint though is that the plastic casing is so cheaply made that I am concerned that the battery/SD card container has a cover which can easily be broken; likewise the connection cover for the computer is even more flimsy.  I could manage without the latter cover but if the battery cover breaks off, then what?  Guess I'll use it until Canon produces a similar zoom lightweight camera at a reasonable price.  The product is reasonably priced for what it can do.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA
Reviews.Author: samueladm
Reviews.Content: This camera is a heaping pile of Garbage. I had it for about 1 year and then all it says is turn on and off again useless!!!! I did not drop it submerge it in water nothing just decided to crap out on me one day!!!USELESS

Reviews.Title: not great pictures!
Reviews.Author: Natalia C. Orrego
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because I wanted something not too expensive that would give me good zoom and megapixels, in other words better pictures. I have had it for about six months and I don't believe the pictures turn out great, most of the time they are fuzzy, also I am still having trouble figuring out the flash, it is either too bright or not bright enough. I have tried changing the settings on it and the shutter speed is delayed always unless you set it to take continuos pictures at a time. If I had the opportunity to repurchase I would probably consider getting a more realible brand camera.

Reviews.Title: fuji film
Reviews.Author: A. Brazdzionis
Reviews.Content: I like the camera like that i can take so many pics quickly and efficently still have lots to learn w/ camera, but it does take great pics.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality, mediocre pictures
Reviews.Author: Amanda B
Reviews.Content: This camera gave us an error message out of the box. We found that if we held the battery door a certain way we could get it to function and took a couple of photos with it before sending it back. The indoor, low light picture quality was poorer than the Fuji FinePix F10 we bought 5 years ago. Lots of noise.

Reviews.Title: FINE PIX
Reviews.Author: Ronald
Reviews.Content: I have used the small box type cameras from FUJI and this camera seems to be the same except for the 35mm style body. Fuji makes very good cameras, this s1800 seems to be one of them.

Reviews.Title: Ugly Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: Michael Davis
Reviews.Content: Fujifilm FinePix S1800 looks good outside but it does not take good pictures.In fact the pictures are ugly - they do not represent the reality.Pictures taken with this camera do not represent the reality.PROBLEM 1The colors on the pictures are messed up and do not show the real life colors of the subject. For example, instead of Red or Burgundy the camera shows Brown or Brownish colors. Other cameras including FinePix S1500 do not do that.PROBLEM 2The colors are not vivid and are barely noticeable. The pictures look like something in between Black/White and Color pictures.PROBLEM 3"Chrome" function to enhance colors and make them move vivid does not work either.PROBLEM 4My FinePix S1800 makes all pictures extremely dark - much darker then in reality. And that happens in all lighting conditions. For example, all daytime pictures look like they were taken in the late evening.Any $50 takes better pictures then Fujifilm FinePix S1800

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Abid
Reviews.Content: This camera is a really good buy. Has a lot of really nice features, and is very easy to use. And the zoom feature is really cool :)

Reviews.Title: Low-Light needs more light other than that it's okay
Reviews.Author: tipstir "My Professional Review"
Reviews.Content: Yes the Low-light needs more light for the best picture. You can take it without the extra light, but if you want to see what your doing you might want to add the light. I was going to box the S1800 back up and send it back. But now decided to keep it. Today I did some more testing and found out I can change the ISO which is max out at 6400. Default is 100 (Auto SR) M ISO 800 is better to use. If you change it to 1600 in low-light they it's to grainy. I think Fujifilm was trying to make this Digital SLR-Like easy for everyone to use. Well in a way it is easy. You get a lot for the money. I quickly ditch the Panasonic Batteries for Sanyo Eneloop you can take 500 digital shots with those you can find them here with the quick charger: http://www.amazon.com/Sanyo-Eneloop-Pre-Charged-Rechargable-Batteries/dp/B000IV0REA/ref=sr_1_5?ie=UTF8&s;=electronics&qid;=1269578616&sr;=1-5. 4x AA is what the S1800 uses. Here's shot of the micro-close-up:[...]The image above convince me to keep the S1800, otherwise it would have gone back in for a full refund. Indoor shots using ISO 800 instead of Auto 100 were better. Blue snow clears up when you move the camera to the lite area. I had given S1800 a poor score but after taking some more images to day I gave it 4 out of 5 stars. Make sure you get the latest firmware update from Fujifilm. Best way to get that into the Camera is to use SD card and download the file to your computer and copy it to the SD card. Fujifilm gives you app to move the file to SD card. Don't know why they do that. Still you turn off the S1800 and then press power and press the DISP/Back button. After that it will ask you do you want to upgrade the firmware you say yes indeed!There is also HD mode, still for what you get 720p, external speaker to here back your video. I have something else for video which is small and has stereo sound. The S1800 is mono, but good enough. I am using Lexar Platinum II 16GB 60x SDHC card found here on Amazon: http://www.amazon.com/Lexar-Platinum-Class-Memory-LSD16GBSBNA060/dp/B0027VT6SW/ref=sr_1_20?ie=UTF8&s;=electronics&qid;=1269578532&sr;=1-20. The camera can handle 32GB also.I would recommend S1800

Reviews.Title: Sent it back
Reviews.Author: TRid
Reviews.Content: I was unimpressed. Very fuzzy screen especially through the viewfinder. Going with The Panasonic or Canon instead.

Reviews.Title: Eh...
Reviews.Author: Stephanie L. Bryant "Stephanie L.B."
Reviews.Content: I originally bought the Canon SX20IS but when I received it it had a loose part. After returning it I decided to try out the Fujifilm S1800. Bad idea! I received the camera 6 hours ago and I am ready to send it back. The LCD screen is fuzzy and it feels like a toy. It was too light and the plastic made it feel cheap. I guess when trying to save money... you get what you pay for. Junk!

ProductInfo.Features:
12.2-megapixel, 1/2.3-inch CCD for photo-quality poster-sized prints
